As part of Prati Ghare Sushasan (good governance in every house) campaign and to acknowledge the contribution of best tax-payers of the state, a felicitation programme for taxpayers was held at Pragna Bhavan in Agartala on Wednesday.

Deputy Chief Minister Jishnu Dev Varma inaugurated the event in the presence of Secretary (Finance) Brijesh Pandya, Chief Commissioner of Taxes Rakhi Biswas and representatives of all other stakeholders, organized by the Taxes organization under the aegis of the Department of Finance. A total of 30 best taxpayers have been felicitated by the department.

While addressing the gathering Deputy Chief Minister said that the taxpayers are the key players in moving the state forward and the MSMEs are the major contributors to the growth and development in the country. The revenue comes from the taxpayers’ playing a vital role for pushing up the state towards the best and self-reliant, said Dev Varma.

Dy Chief Minister Jishnu Devvarma who is also the Finance Minister of the state said that honest payment of tax to the government is the quality and characteristic of a good citizen. The taxpayers are the key partners of development in the state to make Tripura self-reliant. The backbone of the economy of the state is the businessmen and taxpayers, if their business keeps flourishing, the progress of the state also continues.

The revenue collected from taxes often plays a significant rule for the development of the state, said secretary of Finance department Brijesh Pandey and congratulating all the honest tax payers, he added that simplification and user friendly tax policy are now getting its results as now tax collection has increased at 25 % better results with an increase of 25% in tax collection. Tax collection is done through negotiation with a friendly approach towards the trading community, said Pandey.

During the programme Chief Commissioner of Taxes Rakhi Biswas delivered a welcome address and highlighted the objectives of the day’s programme.

During the programme 30 best taxpayers including the best tax-payer of the state Biplab Roy were felicitated by the department.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Reckless riding: 3 falls from flyover, one dies, 2 seriously injured
tripura.description: In a burning instance of reckless motorbike riding, one youth was killed and two others sustained critical injuries, when trio in a motorbike with heavy speed crashed with a pillar of Agartala’s lone flyover and strait fell on the ground road on Tuesday midnight.
tripura.content:
In a burning instance of reckless motorbike riding, one youth was killed and two others sustained critical injuries, when trio in a motorbike with heavy speed crashed with a pillar of Agartala’s lone flyover and strait fell on the ground road on Tuesday midnight.

Police sources said that on Tuesday midnight at about 12 AM, the firefighters of Agartala station hearing a heavy sound of crush, rushed to the spot and found that three youths along with a compressed motorbike fell from flyover in the ground road and they were immediately shifted to GB Hospital.

Soon after reaching the hospital, one Karan Debbarma, son of Rajesh Debbarma of TRTC area of Krishnagar died and two of his friends including Debasish Debbarma, son of Bhabesh Debbarma of Kadamtali area under West Agartala police station and another youth identified as Samrat Das , son of Swapan Das of Ramnagar area were admitted to GB Hospital in critical conditions.

Sources said all these youths including the deceased youth Karan were the final year students of MBB College and they met the tragic road accident due to their rash and reckless driving.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: City police burst chain snatching network, 5 arrested including govt employee, loan company manager
tripura.description: The Agartala city police in a significant breakthrough have bursted a big racket of chain snatching to sanctioning of gold loans by few executives of Manappuram Gold Finance Ltd and arrested five persons involved in the racket and also recovered two stolen gold chains.
tripura.content:
The Agartala city police in a significant breakthrough have bursted a big racket of chain snatching to sanctioning of gold loans by few executives of Manappuram Gold Finance Ltd and arrested five persons involved in the racket and also recovered two stolen gold chains.

Addressing a press conference here at West Agartala police station on Tuesday afternoon, SDPO(Sadar) Ajoy Kumar Das along with OC of West Agartala police station Jayanta Kumar Dey said that during investigation of a chain snatching case registered on September 23rd last, the West Agartala police station and the investigating officer (IO) of the case SI Abhijit Mondal get some vital information and planned a operation.

As per the plan, the police conducted raids on Monday night, which continued till Tuesday morning and arrested five persons including a government employee and manager of Manappuram Gold Finance Ltd for their direct involvement in the snatching network.

He said that police team first managed to arrest two gold chain snatchers identified as Amrit Roy and Sagar Namo, both are from Anandanagar area under Srinagar police station and based on the confessional statements, police arrested two persons, who were purchasing the stolen gold jewelleries in cheap rate from the snatchers including an government employee of Barjala school, identified as Mintu Das of South Ramnagar area and his associate Amaresh Chakraborty of Kalikapur area under West Agartala police station.

Das said after interrogating four arrested miscreants, police arrested the manager of Manappuram Gold Finance Ltd, located at Agartala , Riman Chakraborty , who has given them easy gold finance facilities without verifying any documents.

So, the city police has bursted the entire network of gold chain snatching and arrested five persons, who will be produced before a local court with police remand appeals to unearth the entire network of thieves, said Das.

He said that police have initiated a massive investigation to find out the rule of Manappuram Gold Finance Ltd and are there other gold items in their deposit, which were stolen items. Das added that a detailed investigation would be carried out and if any other persons involved in the racket will also be arrested soon.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: MoS Pratima Bhowmik review progress of Smart City Projects, holistic measure for beautification of Agartala city
tripura.description: The Agartala Smart City Mission on Tuesday conducted the meeting of the City Level Advisory Forum, chaired by Union Minister of state Pratima Bhowmik and reviewed the progress of the smart city projects. The meeting also detailed discussion over the initiatives taken by the Agartala Smart City Limited (ASCL), which is gradually gaining momentum for the beautiful Agartala city.
tripura.content:
The Agartala Smart City Mission on Tuesday conducted the meeting of the City Level Advisory Forum, chaired by Union Minister of state Pratima Bhowmik and reviewed the progress of the smart city projects. The meeting also detailed discussion over the initiatives taken by the Agartala Smart City Limited (ASCL), which is gradually gaining momentum for the beautiful Agartala city.

Speaking in the meeting Union Minister Pratima Bhowmik said that entire construction works under the smart city projects are going on in the fastest way. She said that within the next two months two main roads including Airport and Akhaura roads will be completed and added that soon Agartala city will be among the beautiful cities of the country.

While, giving details of the progress of the works constructed by the ASCL, the chief executive officer (CEO) of ASCL and commissioner of Agartala Municipal Corporation (AMC) Dr Shailesh Kumar Yadav said that the meeting had detailed discussion to review the completed works, on-going works and future plans of ASCL. The meeting has also shared the detailed information over funds sanctioned from both central and state governments and about a clear picture over the utilization of funds.

He said that till date a total Rs. 372 crore received including Rs. 294 crores has been received from Central government and Rs. 78 crore from state government and till date the ASCL has completed construction works of Rs. 342 crore.

A total of 66 projects have been taken for Agartala smart city mission and among these projects, the construction works of 49 projects have already been completed and now 17 projects are going on.

Among these projects, the big projects including Airport Road project (Cost of Rs. 91 crore) and by the end of January, 2023 next , the ASCL will complete the four lane road , said Dr Yadav and added that another project financed by Asian Development Bank (ADB) at Ujjayanta palace including beautification and construction of Asia’s longest fountain along with nine components including beautification of gardens with laser light project.

In MBB College Lake, a big project is under going on and to reduce the inundated problems of Agartala city, five new pumps were installed, 30 kilometers of storm-water drain constructed and monitoring systems from integrated command control station have also been set up, said Dr Yadav.

He said ASCL has been appreciated by different national media for the measures taken to reduce the inundated problems of the city and added more measures including six mobile diesel pumps has been installed in the city to reduce the water logging problems along with five static pumps.

Dr Yadav said that many parks and lakes inside the Agartala city have been beautified including the Albert Ekka war memorial, which was appreciated by the President Droupadi Murmu during her visit to Agartala.

Among major projects taken by ASCL, Howrah river front project and a stretch of 2 kilometers riverfront site like Savarmati riverfront will be set up and people of the city can enjoy their cycling, running in the complete two km stretch. He said that river water and sewerage systems near the riverfront site will be cleared along with strengthening of the embankment boundary.

The citizen level advisory forum has also given their suggestion and ASCL has also accepted their proposals, because no projects will be sustainable without public support, which is the aim of ASCL to create awareness.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Nath inaugurates PG courses in six-degree colleges
tripura.description: The Postgraduate courses in English and Bengali language introduced in 6 (six)colleges in the state and Education Minister ratan Lal Nath on Tuesday.
tripura.content:
The Postgraduate courses in English and Bengali language introduced in 6 (six)colleges in the state and Education Minister ratan Lal Nath on Tuesday.

Nath while addressing the central inaugural programme of the PG courses held at Women’s College Matangini Pritilata auditorium in the presence of other guests and academicians, staff and students said that Tripura has a quality education hub in the North-eastern region. So many NAAC-accredited colleges are functional in the state to impart the best education to the aspirants' students. A women's University will start functioning in the state from next year, and Buddhist University is also being started in Sabroom next.

Besides, endeavours are being taken to start 4 more privately managed universities in the state.

The Master Degree courses in MA (English and Bengali) has been started in six-degree colleges of the state including in MBB College, Women’s College, Belonia College, Netaji Subhash memorial college in Udaipur, Ramkrishna college in Kailasahar and in Dharmanagar degree college.

The MBB College have seat capacity of 30 student each in English and Bengali, 15 Bengali and 20 in English at Women’s college, Belonia college have 20 each in English and Bengali, Udaipur college 10 each in both subjects, in Kailasahar college 10 in Bengali and 9 in English and Dharmanagar government degree college have seat capacity of 11 for Bengali and 9 for MA (English) course.

Education Minister Ratan Lal Nath also said that students are the backbone of a nation as well as the future of the country. Hence, they have to be educated with a proactive mindset with true nationalism. Prime Minister Narendra Modi is leading the country to make enormous progress in all directions and the Tripura government is abiding by the directive of the visionary Prime Minister to achieve holistic development in the education sector. The present government is confident that the students of the state must be successful if they take advantage of the infrastructural development made in the state in the field of education, he added. Special job-oriented training is also given to all candidates to crack competitive exams for IAS, IFS, IPS etc . At present there 25-degree colleges are imparting higher education to the students out of them 21-degree colleges have already been brought under NAAC accreditation.

In a tiny state like Tripura so many educational institutions including IIIT, National Forensic Science university, National Law University and many more universities in the pipeline , said Nath and extended his best wishes to the students for their future endeavours.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: CEO, Tripura relieved from charges of other departments
tripura.description: The state government through a minor reshuffle order has relieved the Chief Electoral Officer (CEO), Tripura Kiran Gitte from the charges of other departments.
tripura.content:
The state government through a minor reshuffle order has relieved the Chief Electoral Officer (CEO), Tripura Kiran Gitte from the charges of other departments.

The General Administration (personnel and training) department of the state through a notification said that incumbent CEO, Kiran Gitte, who is holding the charges of secretary for Election, PWD including DWS and Urban Development department is relieved from the charges of Public Works including DWS and Urban department.

As per the standard protocol of the Election Commission of India (ECI), the CEO of the state is only to assign with the charges of Election department as the ensuing assembly elections of the state to be held in the mid part of February, 2023 next.

The General Administration has also given the additional charges of Public Works including DWS and Urban Development departments to incumbent secretary Abhishek Singh (IAS), who is holding the charges as secretary of Co-operation Education (SW and SE) and Labour departments and relieved from the charge of Co-operation department.

The incumbent secretary Tapas Roy (IAS) of OBC Welfare, Minorities Welfare and Home (jail) departments will also hold the charge of Co-operation department in addition.

The government in another notification has appointed five officers to the post of TCS Grade-II officers against promotion quota from the feeder posts and they are Jiban Kumar Acharjee, Gaya Debbarma, Asish Kumar Sarkar, Pritam Kumar Debbarma and Debendra Sarkar.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: TMC’s mega rally in Agartala, leaders assured to implement Bengal model in Tripura if they voted to power
tripura.description: As scheduled, Trinamool Congress (TMC) on Monday organized mass rally from Ganghighat to Rabindra Satabarshiki Bhavan in Agartala in presence of senior leaders of the party from West Bengal and the rally, leaders also addressed  a large gathering in the city protesting ‘misgovernance’ of Tripura.
tripura.content:
As scheduled, Trinamool Congress (TMC) on Monday organized mass rally from Ganghighat to Rabindra Satabarshiki Bhavan in Agartala in presence of senior leaders of the party from West Bengal and the rally, leaders also addressed a large gathering in the city protesting ‘misgovernance’ of Tripura.

The rally of TMC worker in presence of hundreds of party supporters from different parts of the state started on Monday morning from Gandhighat and ends in front of Rabindra Satabarshiki Bhavan, where the leaders like Rajya Sabha MP Sushmita Dev , state in-charge Rajib Banerjee , All India TMC Mahila wing president and MP Smt Kakoli Ghosh Dastidar and MP Smt Mahua Moitra addressed the gathering.

While addressing the gathering senior TMC leader and MP Mahua Moitra through interactive speech said that if her party voted to power in Tripura, all the welfare schemes existing in West Bengal will be introduced in Tripura.

She said that ruling BJP believes in welfare of their party and TMC believes in welfare of the public and that is the difference, people of Bengal ensure their huge victory in the last assembly elections.

She said that BJP often promises freebies and after polls they forget their commitments, but TMC do politics where the public welfare is the top priority.

Citing the instances of governance of West Bengal, Moitra said that there is no disparity in Bengal and claimed that there are not a single family who are facing starvation and public distribution services are so strong that no one has to worry about their two meals.

Speaking in the gathering Rajib Banerjee said that there movements to oust the BJP government is getting momentum in every passing days and more and more people joining the party to strengthen their movements against the oppression politics of BJP.

MP Sushmita Dev said that only TMC can defeat the communal BJP and will bring the governance for people not for the party.

Trinamool Women wing national president Kakali Ghosh Dastidar said that despite their continuous attacks, BJP can never prevent the TMC and its courageous workers and TMC will continue to strive for the interest of the state's people . Ghosh Dastidar also said that TMC with all its strength continued its movements to oust ‘undemocratic force’ from Tripura. She also said that the contribution of Mamata Benrjee and her governance in the lives of people helped TMC to retain power for the third time in Bengal and people from cross sections of society are getting benefits of all welfare schemes of the government.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Govt committed to improve lives through co-operatives, Minister
tripura.description: The 69th All India Co-operative Week-2022 celebrated across the state on Monday  with the theme of  “75th Independence, progress and future action of co-operative” where the Co-operative Minister Prem Kumar Reang inaugurated the main programme held at Agartala Town hall.
tripura.content:
The 69th All India Co-operative Week-2022 celebrated across the state on Monday with the theme of "75th Independence, progress and future action of co-operative" where the Co-operative Minister Prem Kumar Reang inaugurated the main programme held at Agartala Town hall.

Minister Prem Kumar Reang in his inaugural speech said that the state government has been ensuring development in all sectors to generate more employment opportunities for the youths of the state.

He said Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Union Co-operative Minister Amit Shah have taken holistic measures to improve the rural economy of the country through Co-operative movements. He said that the government has taken initiatives to provide employment opportunities to educated youths through co-operative and to strengthen the progress of the nation, people have strengthened the cooperative movements.

The government organises the co-operative week with the aim to create job opportunities.

A co-operative conference of two days was organized at Delhi recently where ministers of the states participated and held discussion on expansion of co-operative movements to generate more jobs for youths.

During the state level programme, MLA Krishnadhan Das in his speech said that the importance of Co-operative Society is huge and it will also help to form "Ek Tripura Srestha Tripura and also Ek Bharat Sreshtha Bharat".

The Minister also inaugurated the micro-ATM services for Dhanpur branch of the Tripura State Co-Operative Bank and with the launching of UPI payment system. The Minister during the celebration of the day has also launched different kinds of sweets made by the Gomati Co-operative Milk Producers Union.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Tripura exports 2nd consignment of natural rubber to Nepal
tripura.description: In its second consignment , Tripura has exported 14,550 kilograms of Natural Rubber to Nepal by the Agartala branch of Manimalayar rubbers.
tripura.content:
In its second consignment , Tripura has exported 14,550 kilograms of Natural Rubber to Nepal by the Agartala branch of Manimalayar rubbers.

Tripura, which is the second largest natural rubber producing state in the country after Kerala and Rubber Board through its second consignment are exploring the international markers for Tripura rubber.

The Manimalayar Rubbers Pvt Ltd, promoted by the Rubber Board, had exported 18 tonne natural rubber (sheet rubber) to Nepal in 2020 and a similar quantity to Bangladesh in 2000 from Tripura.

General Manager of the Manimalayar Rubbers, Arunabha Majumdar, said that 14,550 kg rubber latex (Cenex) valued at Rs 12.42 lakh produced in Tripura was exported to Kathmandu and the rubber consignment was ferried to Nepal on Friday by road through the Raxaul-Birgunj border route.

He said that the consignment is likely to reach its destination in a week through the Bihar-Nepal border. Manimalayar Rubbers, which has branch offices in Guwahati, Silchar and Tura in Meghalaya, has been extending marketing support to the producers since 1997.

At present, Tripura is cultivating natural rubber on 89,264 hectares of land, annually producing 93,371 tonnes of rubber worth Rs 1,691 crore. About two lakh families, including tribals, are directly or indirectly associated with rubber cultivation in Tripura.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: DYFI, TYF to organize state-wide movements from Nov 15 demanding jobs for all
tripura.description: The Democratic Youth Federation of India (DYFI) and Tribal Youth Federation (TFY) will organize state-wide movements from November 15 to 17 demanding jobs for all unemployed youth and three other charters of demands.
tripura.content:
The Democratic Youth Federation of India (DYFI) and Tribal Youth Federation (TFY) will organize state-wide movements from November 15 to 17 demanding jobs for all unemployed youth and three other charters of demands.

Addressing a press conference here at ‘Chhatra Yuva Bhavan’ in Agartala on Sunday afternoon, DYFI’s state secretary Nabarun Deb accompanied by its president Palash Bhowmik alleged that during 56 months rule of BJP-IPFT government in Tripura, the unemployment rate of the state increasing in alarming rate compared to other parts of the country and state government of instead of giving any permanent solution to unemployed youths are appoint only few section of youths through out-sourcing and contractual basis.

Nabarun Deb said that the state government had conducted JRBT examinations on August 20 and 22, 2021 last and after passing of 15 months, they are not declaring the results for 4910 posts for Group-C and D.

Similarly, the qualified candidates of Selection Test for Graduate Teachers (STGT) under Teachers’ Recruitment Board, Tripura (TRBT) are continuing their agitation demanding their jobs, but the government is doing nothing to recruit qualified youths despite the huge number of vacant posts in the Education department.

He alleged that all the government hospitals and other health institutions are also running huge shortages of medical staff including doctors, nurses and other para-medics, but there are no recruitment processes, resulting in the health services of the state deteriorating day by day.

He said that in the past four and half years, above 16000 teachers have gone on retirement, but very less recruitment in similar periods. The majority of schools in rural areas are also running with huge shortages of teachers, which has affected the education systems of the state.

While, speaking in the press meet, DYFI’s state president Palash Bhowmik said that in support of their four-point charter of demands including job for all, stopping contractual and out-sourcing process of employment and restoration of law-and-order situation, the DYFI and TYF will organize state-wide movements from November 15 to 17 next and appealed to the people of the state to come forward to strengthen their movements for welfare of state’s youths.

They also strongly condemned the attack in a blood donation camp in Barpatari area of South Tripura district and demanded police action. They alleged that when state’s hospitals are running with a severe crisis of blood units, the youths supporting DYFI are coming forward to contribute for the great cause of human life, miscreants have continued their attacks, even the attacks of the blood donors. DYFI leaders asked the Chief Minister can he restrain the anti-social activities of BJP supporters or should the DYFI stop their social responsibilities?

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: TMC’s mass rally in Agartala today, Mahua, Kakali to attend
tripura.description: Trinamool Congress (TMC) on Monday will organize a mass protest rally in Agartala from Gandhighat to Rabindra Bhavan in presence of senior leaders of the party from West Bengal.
tripura.content:
Trinamool Congress (TMC) on Monday will organize a mass protest rally in Agartala from Gandhighat to Rabindra Bhavan in presence of senior leaders of the party from West Bengal.

Addressing a press conference in Agartala on Sunday, party’s Rajya Sabha MP Sushmita Dev accompanied by state in-charge Rajib Banerjee said that mass rally in participation of TMC supporters from different parts of the state will participate in the protest rally against ‘misrule’ of BJP government.

Rajib Banerjee said that Lok Sabha MP and president All India TMC Mahila wing president and MP Smt Kakoli Ghosh Dastidar and MP Smt Mahua Moitra will arrive in the state on Monday will participate in the procession and will also address the mass gathering in front of Rabindra Satabarshiki Bhavan.

Banerjee alleged that ruling party supporters are continuing their attacks on TMC supporters and leaders in different parts of the state and threatening their workers not to participate in the proposed big rally with dire consequences. He added that despite all obstructions created by the ruling party, the people of the state will witness a mega rally by TMC workers and supporters in Agartala on Monday.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Child raped by sexagenarian man in Kamalpur
tripura.description: In a heartrending in incident, sexagenarian old man was arrested by Kamalpur police station under Dhalai district after he allegedly raped a child, aged two years and eight months only.
tripura.content:
In a heartrending in incident, sexagenarian old man was arrested by Kamalpur police station under Dhalai district after he allegedly raped a child, aged two years and eight months only.

Police sources said that based on a complaint registered at Kamalpur police station on November 12 last, police immediately registered a specific case against the accused person and started investigation.

Necessary legal steps have been taken including medical check up of the victim minor girl, who is now under treatment in Kamalpur BSM Hospital.

Police added that they have arrested accused person identified as Jamsed Ali (64) of North Halahali under the same police station within a few hours of the heinous crime. On Sunday, accused was produced before a local court for further legal proceedings.

Local sources said that Jamsed Ali taking the advantage of the loneliness of the victim girl house, raped the child. When her parents returned back to their house realised the situation and immediately shifted their child into hospital after her condition deteriorated. The local villagers demanding capital punishment of arrested rapist claimed accused was earlier also involved such criminal activities.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: BJP’s ST Morcha leaders attacked at Baramura hill ranges; police fired in blank
tripura.description: Massive violence erupted at the National Highway-8 portion of Baramura Hill Ranges on Saturday evening after the convoy of BJP’s ST Morcha national president Samir Oraon was allegedly attack by some unruly supporters of Tipra-Motha, who are returning their homes after participated in the massive rally in Agartala. Security forces had fired five rounds in blank to disperse the mob and rescued BJP leaders..
tripura.content:
Massive violence erupted at the National Highway-8 portion of Baramura Hill Ranges on Saturday evening after the convoy of BJP’s ST Morcha national president Samir Oraon was allegedly attack by some unruly supporters of Tipra-Motha, who are returning their homes after participated in the massive rally in Agartala. Security forces had fired five rounds in blank to disperse the mob and rescued BJP leaders.

Sources said that amidst heavy traffic jams in the Baramura Hill ranges on Saturday evening, when the convoy of BJP’s ST Morcha national president and MP Samir Oraon passes through the Bankumari temple area of national highway, large number of Motha supporters were returning their homes, suddenly blockade the road, which created massive traffic jams.

After noticing the convoy of BJP leaders including state ST Morcha president Bikash Debbarma, MDC Bidyut Debbarma and former MDC Pratiram Tripura, a large number of people allegedly supporters of Tipra-Motha started heavy stone pelting targeting the convoy of BJP leaders.

At a time, the mob started approaching the vehicles of BJP leaders and they severally ransacked two vehicles of the convoy. In the meantime, security guards of the BJP leaders tried to resist the mob, but they continued their violent attacks. Then, the personnel security officers (PSOs) of the leaders fired five rounds in the air to disperse the agitated mob and somehow rescued the leaders including MP Samir Oraon.

Police sources said that after the incident was reported, a large number of security forces led by Additional SP (Khowai) and SDPO(Kalyanpur) Prasun Tripura rushed to the spot and tried to defuse the tension.

ADC’s Executive Member (EM) Kamal Koloi was also present at the spot and police forces after clearing the road have also released all stranded vehicles and their passengers towards the destinations.

While, after safely returned back to Agartala, speaking with media persons MP Samir Oraon and Bikash Debbarma said that they were returning from Kanchanpur and when their vehicles reached near Bankumari temple in Baramura, large number of Tipra-Motha supporters attacked on their convoy with heavy stone pelting targeting their vehicles. Samir Oraon said that Motha supporters had also ransacked their two vehicles, but they were narrowly escaped from violent attack by Motha supporters due to timely action taken by their security guards.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Govt released offer letters for 1482 graduate teachers
tripura.description: The state government on Friday released the offer of appointment for 1482 graduate teachers under, who are qualified under Teacher Eligibility Test (TET)-2.
tripura.content:
The state government on Friday released the offer of appointment for 1482 graduate teachers under, who are qualified under Teacher Eligibility Test (TET)-2.

Addressing a press conference here at Civil Secretariat on Friday evening, Education Minister Ratan Lal Nath said that from November 15 next the Master Degree courses in MA (English and Bengali) will commence in six-degree colleges of the state including in MBB College, Women’s College, Belonia College, Netaji Subhash memorial college in Udaipur, Ramkrishna college in Kailasahar and in Dharmanagar degree college.

The MBB College have seat capacity of 30 student each in English and Bengali, 15 Bengali and 20 in English at Women’s college, Belonia college have 20 each in English and Bengali, Udaipur college 10 each in both subjects, in Kailasahar college 10 in Bengali and 9 in English and Dharmanagar government degree college have seat capacity of 11 for Bengali and 9 for MA (English) course.

Nath said that before the BJP-IPFT government came into power had assured the state’s people that the new government will provide government jobs to one family member, who had lost their nearest one due to political violence and till date the government has received 26 applications. The government has also formed a scrutiny committee to give the jobs, said Nath and added that so far 8 persons were given jobs and names of seven candidates were sent for review and names of seven persons were sent to different departments after recommendation by the review committee.

Nath also announced the names of 25 new ‘Vidyajyoti’ scheme schools in addition to 100 existing Vidyajyoti schools and these schools will be converted into Vidyajyoti schools in 2023-24 academic years.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Hunger strike by retrenched teachers continues for 24 days, many hospitalized so far
tripura.description: On the 24th day of the “fast unto death” programme by a section of retrenched 10,323 teachers, the health conditions of many teachers deteriorated and they were shifted to IGM Hospital.
tripura.content:
On the 24th day of the "fast unto death" programme by a section of retrenched 10,323 teachers, the health conditions of many teachers deteriorated and they were shifted to IGM Hospital.

They started sit-in-demonstration from October 20 demanding their reinstatement in service and till Friday, dozens of teachers were hospitalized.

Altogether 10,323 of teachers, who lost jobs after the High Court of Tripura terminated their appointments as illegal in 2014 and termination of their ad-hoc jobs after Supreme Court verdict, the retrenched teachers are continuing their agitation hunger strike, protest rallies and march to secretariat and Raj Bhavan for past few years, but till date they were not rehabilitated or reinstatement in service.,

Speaking with media persons on the 24th day of their ‘fast unto death’ programme, some agitated retrenched teachers claimed that Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha, during a meeting with a delegation representing the retrenched teachers, had given assurance that a detailed discussion over the possibility of job restoration would be held after Lakshmi puja in the presence of heads of departments including Law secretary and Advocate General of the state, but till date no such measures have been taken for their rehabilitation.

They also alleged that before beginning the hunger strike programme, the retrenched teachers had duly informed all the departments of the state to cooperate with them by providing them some logistic support like toilet and drinking water facilities in their agitation venue at Orient Choumohani in Agartala. But, no such help had been given to them and even on the 23rd day of hunger strike, they were also not providing ambulances to shift their ailing teachers into hospital.

Speaking with media, retrenched teacher leader Arabinda Sharma said that with due regards they are still very much hopeful that Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha will call them and do something for their reinstatement of jobs. He said that their families are running a severe financial crisis after losing their jobs 32 months ago and they are continuing their fast unto death programme only with moral support of hundreds of teachers, who have lost their jobs. He said due to the autocratic decision of the Education department, so far, they have lost 145 teachers. He said that they are hopeless and still continuing their fast unto death programme and appealed to the Chief Minister to protect their lives.

Sharma said that they want the government to convene the meeting at the earliest, as promised by the Chief Minister and should give a green signal to withdraw their ‘fast unto death’ programme and reiterated that they will continue their agitation till a final solution is assured by the government.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: 50 thousand fish farmer families brought under CMSPY in the present financial year
tripura.description: A total of 50,240 fish farmer families of the state were brought under ‘Chief Minister Swanirbhar Parivar Yojana’ in the financial year 2022-23. Under the scheme, 4 crore 10 lakh rupees has been approved in the present financial year, said Principal Secretary of Fisheries department B.S. Sharma while addressing a press meet to highlight the  progress and achievements of different public welfare schemes of the Fisheries department.
tripura.content:
A total of 50,240 fish farmer families of the state were brought under ‘Chief Minister Swanirbhar Parivar Yojana’ in the financial year 2022-23. Under the scheme, 4 crore 10 lakh rupees has been approved in the present financial year, said Principal Secretary of Fisheries department B.S. Sharma while addressing a press meet to highlight the progress and achievements of different public welfare schemes of the Fisheries department.

He said that the target has been set to provide 500 fish fingerlings to 50 thousand fish farmer families every year i.e., 1 lakh 50 thousand fish farmer families as well as one-day training under Chief Minister Swanirbhar Parivar Yojana. The Principal Secretary said that 2,575 fish farmers of SC community will be provided with assistance under Pradhan Mantri Anusuchit Jaati Abhudyay Yojana in the financial year 2022-23. The state government has recently started this scheme as a part of Prati Ghare Sushason campaign. So far, 575 SC fish farmers were given 10 thousand rupees each along with necessary items and fingerlings in the present financial year under Pradhan Mantri Anusuchit Jaati Abhudyay Yojana. Under the scheme, each member of 70 Self- Help Groups formed with 10 SC fish farmers have been provided with assistance of 10 thousand rupees along with necessary items. The Principal Secretary informed that the SHGs were also provided with fish seeds.

He informed that assistance has been provided to 1 thousand SC fish farmers for revival and repair of old water bodies. Assistance will be provided to 300 SC fish farmers for fish farming in Biofloc method.

He said that an implementing unit by the Fisheries department (Fishery PIU) will be set up under Tripura Rural Economic Growth Service scheme with the assistance of the World Bank. He informed that with the financial assistance of NABARD, the Fisheries department has adopted a caged fish farming awareness scheme in Dumboor Lake as well as in other large water bodies of the state. 1,760 cage fish farming will be done under the scheme, among which 1500 cages will be set up in Dumboor Lake. 1080 cages have been recently set up and these will be inaugurated soon. The principal secretary also informed that IMC Hatchery of Santirbazar sub-division, Muhuripur Gyan Kendra, Karbook and Silachari Gyan Kendra under Karbook sub-division and Chechuwa Gyan Kendra of Amarpur sub-division will be inaugurated gradually. Apart from that, a fish market under Lalchimura Village Committee of Bishalgarh block will be inaugurated on November 14.

Joint Director of Fisheries department Abani Debbarma was also present during the press meet.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Ultimate goal of government to increase income of the people: Santana Chakma
tripura.description: The government with aims to bring the last person of the row under all government schemes  for their elf-dependent and the present state government is working it this direction, stated Social Welfare & Social Education Minister Santana Chakma in a programme of loan distribution under different schemes and social responsibility of bank organized by Tripura Gramin Bank (TGB)at Pecharthal Town Hall under North Tripura district on Friday.
tripura.content:
The government with aims to bring the last person of the row under all government schemes for their elf-dependent and the present state government is working it this direction, stated Social Welfare & Social Education Minister Santana Chakma in a programme of loan distribution under different schemes and social responsibility of bank organized by Tripura Gramin Bank (TGB)at Pecharthal Town Hall under North Tripura district on Friday.

The Minister said, TGB has not only set a benchmark in business but also when it comes to social responsibility. Our government wants to encourage this national initiative of the Gramin Bank. She said, the present government aims to increase income of the people and to assist women to be empowered. Various schemes have been taken for this purpose. The women are being assisted to become self-dependent through Self-Help Groups. Housing, drinking water, lavatories and power connections have been provided to improve the quality of living for the poor and the people living in rural areas. She said the government has provided power connections to few far-flung areas of the Pecharthal block which has never been done before. This is real development for the last person of the society.

Sabhadhipati of Unakoti Zilla Parishad Amalendu Das said, this programme was organized as a part of Prati Ghare Sushason campaign. Gramin Bank is also participating in Prati Ghare Sushason camps through assisting in providing loans to Self-Help Groups and small private business entrepreneurs. The loan seekers also have to assist by timely paying loan installments. Only then others will not face any trouble getting loans. Chairman of Tripura Gramin Bank Satyendra Singh and Pecharthal block BDO Sagar Debbarma also spoke on the occasion. Welcome speech was delivered by Gramin Bank Regional Manager (North) Subhankar Choudhury. The programme was presided over by Pecharthal BAC Chairman Sajal Chakma. DCM Abhijit Das and Tripura Gramin Bank Chief Manager Sailesh Biswaranjan were also present in the programme.

The guests handed over loan grant papers to 12 SHGs of Pecharthal block, loan grant papers to 3 beneficiaries under Swavalamban scheme, loan grant papers to 2 beneficiaries under Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana and winter clothes to 50 beneficiaries in the programme. Financial assistance of 1 thousand 195 rupees each was also provided to 33 beneficiaries of the block for Jhum cultivation.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: NIT Agartala convocation today
tripura.description: The 15th convocation of National Institute of Technology (NIT), Agartala will commence from Saturday afternoon in the Visvesvaraiya auditorium .
tripura.content:
The 15th convocation of National Institute of Technology (NIT), Agartala will commence from Saturday afternoon in the Visvesvaraiya auditorium . On this occasion Padma Shri Dr Deepak B. Pathak , former professor of computer science and engineering in IIT, Mumbai will act as the chief guest . Er Amit Bhattacharjee , managing director Accenture Technology , Bengaluru will grace the occasion as Guest of Honour while Professor Harish Kumar Sharma, Chairperson , Board of Governors and Director NIT Agartala will preside over the function and award the degrees.

At present around 4800 students are studying at NIT, Agartala, There are 9 branches at B-Tech level , 23 specialisations in engineering at masters level and 4 branches at dual degree level. The institute also offers MBA programmes, MCA programme, Msc programmes and doctoral programmes. At the moment 305 research scholars are pursuing their Phd in various fields.

A statement issued by the NIT authority said the NIT Agartala’s performance level is at par with the best institutes in the country. In the year 2022-2023 NIT Agartala has already published 285 research papers in prestigious journals that are indexed. A number of international conferences and workshops have already been organized by NIT, Agartala in the current year. Even in the matter patenting NIT Agartala has achieved a lot as ten patents have been filed , nine already granted and 15 patents have been published. Besides, NIT Agartala has also introduced a Teacher Education programme as per NCTE guideline from the current year.

Apart from all this, NIT Agartala has been regularly introducing new courses of study including computational mathematics, new M-Tech courses in mechanical engineering and artificial intelligence. The syllabus of all subjects taught is being regularly updated and modernized in keeping with the progress being made. Renowned academician Padma Shri Dr Deepak B Phatak, former Professor, Dept. of CSE, IIT Bombay and former Chairman, NIT Agartala is scheduled to grace the event as chief guest and Er Amit Bhattacherjee, Managing Director, Accenture Technology, Bangalore will remain present as the Guest of Honour said Prof Debasish Bhattacherjee, Registrar in-charge of the premier engineering institute of the state.

It may be recalled here that the 14th Convocation was held on November 13th, last year and Padma Bibhushan and former Union Minister Prof Murli Manohar Joshi was the chief guest of the annual mega event .

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: BSF’s inter-frontier handball tournament ends
tripura.description: The Border Security Force, Tripura organized Inter Frontier Handball Competition: 2022-23 at Salbagan, Agartala. Tournament from November 9 to 11 and altogether 176 players from 11 Frontier teams participated in the event.
tripura.content:
The Border Security Force, Tripura organized Inter Frontier Handball Competition: 2022-23 at Salbagan, Agartala. Tournament from November 9 to 11 and altogether 176 players from 11 Frontier teams participated in the event.

Teams of BSF Frontiers both from Eastern and Western border, right from Kashmir to Tripura, actively participated in the tournament and showed true sportsmanship during the competition.

Final match was played between Kashmir Frontier and Jammu Frontier in which Kashmir Frontier defeated Jammu Frontier by 30-29. Chief Guest of the event Sumit Sharan, IG of Tripura Frontier felicitated the winner and runners up team and handed over the winner trophy to Kashmir Frontier team. Officials from state handball association of Tripura along with the referee were also felicitated by the chief guest. On the basis of the tournament, a central team of BSF will be selected which will further represent BSF at national level.

A grand closing ceremony was organized at the Tripura frontier headquarters of the BSF in Salbagan area of Agartala. The Chief Guest IG, BSF, Tripura congratulated all players of different Frontiers who participated in the tournament, lauded their efforts and motivated them to improve. At the end of the closing ceremony, IG formally declared the Inter Frontier Handball Competition: 2022-23 closed.

BSF said that organizing such types of events will certainly create the atmosphere for sportsmanship and competitiveness among Seema Praharis.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Spree of joining in Congress continues before “Bharat Jodo - Tripura Bacho Yatra”
tripura.description: A week before the launching of “Bharat Jodo - Tripura Bacho Yatra” on November 19 by opposition Congress, the spree of joining to Congress from different political parties remained unabated as jubilant opposition and some ruling party leaders started deserting their camp targeting next assembly elections to strengthen the hands of Congress.
tripura.content:
A week before the launching of "Bharat Jodo - Tripura Bacho Yatra" on November 19 by opposition Congress, the spree of joining to Congress from different political parties remained unabated as jubilant opposition and some ruling party leaders started deserting their camp targeting next assembly elections to strengthen the hands of Congress.

In a similar joining programme held at Kalyanpur Congress Bhavan under Khowai district on Thursday, altogether 412 persons from 84 families including some leaders from different political parties joined Congress.

The Pradesh Congress president Birajit Sinha, former MLA Ashish Kumar Saha , Kalyanpur Block Congress president Sadhan Mallik and other leaders of the party welcomed all new party supporters with Congress flags.

Speaking in the programme, PCC president Birajit Sinha said that thousands of supporters from BJP, CPI (M) and TMC will also join Congress in different parts of the state in days to come.

"Today is the big day for Congress, many leaders from ruling party and other like minded opposition parties joined to strengthen the hands of Congress to oust the anti-people BJP government from Tripura," said Sinha and added that more and more people strengthening Congress hands before "Bharat Jodo - Tripura Bacho Yatra" . Criticising the ‘Sushan campaign’ of the state government, Sinha said that through fake campaign the BJP government trying to hide their misdeed, but people of the state will not forget the 55 months long misrule and rule of violence and terror.

Speaking in the programme Ashish Kumar Saha said that the people of the state have decided to unseat the ‘anti-people’ BJP government through democratic means of election and claimed that BJP has ruined the state and hundreds of BJP supporters are now joining Congress for the betrayal politics of BJP government. He also claimed that no peace loving and honest people cannot sustain in BJP as the ruling are being controlled by miscreants and anti-socials. He said that all leaders, who are joining Congress have reposed their faith over ideology of Congress and claimed that Congress is the only party, who can oust the communal BJP from the country.

Welcoming all of them to the Congress fold, Saha urged the leaders to contribute their best to oust the ‘autocratic’ BJP government from Tripura for better future of state’s people.

Mentioning the gang rape incident held at Khash Kalyanpur, Saha said that people of the state know the faces of rapist very well and they are being preparing themselves to give them befitting reply in next assembly elections.

"BJP came to power with false promises and they betrayed with people of the Tripura, now time has come to strengthen the hands of Congress as Congress is the only party to able to oust BJP from Tripura,", said Saha and added that after 55 months rule of BJP, the people of the state are now understood the betrayal politics of BJP.

He also asserted that the BJP has no vote bank as such in Tripura and that is why they have no alternative but to depend on rigging and mafia activities to remain in power. He added that Congress workers will not allow them to continue the hooliganism and will resist those joining hands with people of the state.

Among the new Congress supporters, local BJP leader Parimal Debnath, who has also joined Congress along with his few supporters said that after long fight, people of the state set up the BJP led government in Tripura, but after passing of four and half years, the condition of people deteriorated day by day and major section of BJP leaders are involved with corruption and nepotism.

It may be recalled here that the Tripura Pradesh Congress will observe the "Bharat Jodo - Tripura Bacho Yatra" in all 60 assembly constituencies of the state with an objective to ensure that the concerns and demands of the people reach Delhi.

On November 19 morning AICC general secretary and senior leader Joyram Ramesh will inaugurate the ‘Yatra’ in Agartala and state’s Congress in-charge Dr Ajoy Kumar will inaugurate the ‘Yatra’ in Dharmanagar and Kailasahar on the same day. The Congress workers and all leaders will expedite their movements against ‘misrule’ of the BJP-IPFT government with the inauguration of "Bharat Jodo - Tripura Bacho Yatra" on November 19 and will strengthen its movements against oppression politics of BJP to oust the autocratic government in next assembly elections, said Birajit Sinha.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Zero tolerance against drugs, CM reiterates at state-level meeting of NCORD
tripura.description: The state government has adopted a zero-tolerance policy against drugs and everyone must come together in order to build a drug-free Tripura, said Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha.
tripura.content:
The state government has adopted a zero-tolerance policy against drugs and everyone must come together in order to build a drug-free Tripura, said Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha.

Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha speaking at the state-level meeting of (Narco Co-ordination Centre) NCORD at the Civil Secretariat on Thursday said Union Home Minister Amit Shah has recently mentioned adopting a zero-tolerance policy against drugs and the state government is working with the same vision.

The Chief Minister elaborately spoke about the vision. He directed the concerned department to work cooperatively towards building a drug-free Tripura. He emphasized over usage of scanners in check posts and increasing dog squads, especially on their training. He also mentioned taking necessary action against those who have gained huge sums and property by involving in drug dealing.

Chief Secretary J. K. Sinha said, Tripura is performing well under the drug-free campaign. There will not be any kind of compromise with drugs. He urged cooperation from the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) in order to achieve the target of drug free Tripura.

He also highlighted the significant work of the Forensic Science Laboratory (FSL) of the state. Deputy Director General of Kolkata-based Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB), Northeast Monica Ashish Batra said, the central government has given its consent on opening a zonal office of NCB in the state. Initiative will be taken very soon to start the zonal office. Tripura Police DG Amitabh Ranjan discussed the role of the police administration in the drive against drugs. Secretaries and Principal Secretaries of different departments including Zonal Director of Guwahati-based NCB Sudhangshu Kumar Singh took part in the meeting.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: National Lok Adalat on November 12
tripura.description: The National Lok Adalat will be conducted in the state on November 12 next. Court work will start at 10 am. Apart from Tripura High Court and courts will be set up in all district and sub-divisional court premises of the state.
tripura.content:
The National Lok Adalat will be conducted in the state on November 12 next. Court work will start at 10 am. Apart from Tripura High Court and courts will be set up in all district and sub-divisional court premises of the state.

A total of 6,557 cases will be taken up for disposal in 54 benches. This includes 5,229 cases related to pre-litigation disputes and 1,328 cases pending in court. National Lok Adalat has 4,229 cases relating to repayment of bank loans, 202 motor accident compensation cases, 4 cases relating to land acquisition, 1,000 cases relating to unpaid bills of telecom corporations, 859 cases relating to arbitrary criminal disputes, 98 cases relating to matrimonial disputes, 91 relating to cheque bounce. 51 lawsuits and other civil cases will be taken up for disposal. Meanwhile, a single bench will sit in Tripura High Court. 27 cases will be taken up for disposal in this bench. Maximum 12 benches of Lok Adalat will sit in Agartala court premises. Notice has already been given to both parties, opposites of the case. There will be a help desk for citizens in the court premises. Paralegal volunteers will assist people who have been served notices at the court premises.

Member Secretary of Tripura State Legal Services Authority, Sanjay Bhattacharya requested all concerned to take advantage of case settlement quickly without any legal expenses.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Govt want resettlement process of Bru migrants to be completed at its fixed time: CM
tripura.description: Tripura government is working with a humanitarian approach to complete the resettlement process of all bru migrants at the earliest, said Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha.
tripura.content:
Tripura government is working with a humanitarian approach to complete the resettlement process of all bru migrants at the earliest, said Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha.

The state government wants the resettlement process of Bru migrants to be completed quickly. In this case, if any problem arises, it will be resolved through discussion, said Dr Saha.

Reviewing the situation, Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha said that Bru rehabilitation process has been accelerated only after the present government took over. As a result, a historic agreement was signed with the central government, Tripura government, Mizoram government and Bru representatives on January 16, 2020 to solve the permanent problem of resettlement.

After the tripartite agreement, the state government is working towards the speedy completion of the rehabilitation process.

During the meeting, Principal Secretary of Revenue Department Puneet Agarwal said that the central government has extended the deadline for the Bru rehabilitation process till February 28, 2023 next.

During this period, 6,302 Bru families are in the process of completing the resettlement process at 12 identified places. 4,171 Brus are already in the 10 identified places. The families have been rehabilitated. Remaining 2,131 families are being rehabilitated. The Principal Secretary said that 2,326 houses have been constructed so far.

Also, the rehabilitation sites have roads, electricity, drinking water, schools, Anganwadi centres, health sub-centres, ration shops etc and further infrastructure will be developed. Also, gas connection is being provided to Bru families under Ujjawala Yojana. Principal Secretary said, Bru rehabilitated families have been asked to form cooperative societies.

The process of forming cooperative societies has already started. Deputy Chief Minister Jishnu Dev Varma said in the review meeting that the state government is working sincerely to solve the long-standing problem of Bru rehabilitation. If any problem arises in Bru rehabilitation, initiative will be taken to solve it after discussing it with everyone. Participating in the discussion Chief Secretary J.K Sinha said the work of Bru rehabilitation is progressing satisfactorily. Regular monitoring is being done at the state level to see if the construction of various infrastructures including roads, electricity, drinking water are being done properly or not in rehabilitation areas.

In the review meeting Minister of Tribal Welfare Rampada Jamatia, Minister of Social Welfare and Social Education Department Santana Chakma, Minister of Fisheries Department Prem Kumar Reang, MLA Pramod Reang, Chairman of TIPRA and royal scion Pradyot Kishore Debbarma, PCCF K.S Shetty along with Secretaries of Power, Education, Health Departments and representatives of Bru organization were present in the meeting and participated in the discussion.

It may be recalled here that a day before the review meeting , the Election department has appealed to Bru refugees staying in relief camps in the state to go to resettlement villages and get their names enrolled in the electoral rolls during the special revision of voters' list. The special revision of electoral rolls which has already got underway is scheduled to be over on December 8 to pave the way for publication of final electoral rolls for all the 60 Assembly segments.

The Election department targets to enrol as many as 20,000 Bru voters of around 6,300 families. Altogether 7,165 Bru names have already been enrolled in Tripura while the remaining are expected to get registered in the state's electoral rolls during the special summary revision.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Law and order improved in past 5 yrs, cases of assault, rape declined: CM
tripura.description: The Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha taking charge of Tripura, first time on Wednesday chaired a high level and law and order review meeting with DGP and other senior police officials of districts and subdivisions at police headquarters.
tripura.content:
The Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha taking charge of Tripura, first time on Wednesday chaired a high level and law and order review meeting with DGP and other senior police officials of districts and subdivisions at police headquarters.

After the close door review meeting, the Chief Minister speaking with media persons ruled out the allegation made by the opposition parties and said that after formation of government in 2018, the overall law and overall situation of the state drastically improved.

Giving details of the review meeting, Dr Saha said that as per the statistics of crime data, different kinds of crime rate has been decreased in the state and Tripura now 5th least crime rate state of the country as the data released by the National Crime Records Bureau in 2021.

He said that the political activities by different political parties has increased in the state before the ensuing assembly elections and data provided in the review meeting over crime rate is most satisfactory.

Ruled out the lawlessness situation of the state claimed by the opposition parties, Dr Saha said that the cases of assault, rape and murder have decreased in Tripura since 2018, after the BJP formed government in the state.

"Today, I held a high-level meeting with the director general of police and district superintendents of police (SPs) to review the prevailing law and order situation. The reports submitted to me showed a steep decline in all crimes, be it hurt, assault, rape or murder," said Dr Saha.

In case of hurt or assault, an overall 40 % decline was registered since 2018. Cases of murder and rapes are also declining in the state, said Dr Saha.

Appreciating the rule of police administration, the Chief Minister asked the police officers to continue their efforts to maintain the good law and order situation.

Highlighting the steps taken by the state government to control crime rate, Dr Saha said that highway patrolling system has been introduced and Special Investigation Teams (SITs) are being formed for investigation narcotic related cases and to control the crime against women, 24-hours women help desk has been started in every police stations. He said that apart from seven all women police stations, a new women police station will come at Khowai, which will start functioning soon.

Dues to concrete measures taken by the state government, the crime against women has been decreased to 32 %, said Dr Saha and expressing his happiness over Tripura police’s combat against drug menaces, the Chief Minister said that from 2018 to 2022, police has registered 1900 NDPS Act cases and arrested 2700 accused persons in the same period. He said that Tripura is the second state of the region, which seized large quantities of contraband items.

He added that the government has taken many measures for modernization of state police and introduced Emergency Response Service Systems (ERSS) from 2019 and appointment process to recruit 1100 police constables is going on and 1200 more special police executives will be appointed.

He said that the police officers apprised him of problems faced by them, such as manpower shortage and lack of infrastructure in some places and the government will surely look into these problems at the earliest.

Later, in the meeting the Chief Minister has also issued some instructions for better policing and to maintain the peaceful law and order situation and their efforts to conduct the ensuing assembly elections in a peaceful manner.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Mevar joined Tipra-Motha, Pradyot ruled out any alliance before writing assurance for ‘Greater Tipraland’
tripura.description: Day after resignation as MLA of ruling alliance, IPFT, former minister Mevar Kumar Jamatia on Wednesday formally joined Tipra-Motha along with few other ST leaders from BJP.
tripura.content:
Day after resignation as MLA of ruling alliance, IPFT, former minister Mevar Kumar Jamatia on Wednesday formally joined Tipra-Motha along with few other ST leaders from BJP.

After the joining programme, Tipra-Motha chairman and royal scion Pradyot Kishore Debbarma addressing a press meet on Wednesday afternoon welcomed Jamatia and BJP leader Chandan Tripura in their party.

Highlighting the long family relationship of Mevar Kumar Jamatia from his childhood, Pradyot appreciated the step taken by the Jamatia and hoped that their steps will definitely strengthen their ‘greater Tipraland’ demand.

Speaking in the press meet Jamatia said that it is the right time to join Tipra-Motha and many leaders will join the party in coming days to achieve their goal of ‘greater Tipraland’. He said that many of his followers from their erstwhile IPFT have also joined Motha. He said among the 34 divisions of IPFT, about 90 % leaders and supporters have already joined Motha and many organizations of IPFT have also merged with Motha. "We will go to the homes of other IPFT leaders to join the Motha and days to come, the Motha will achieve the goal by winning the next assembly elections for their community".

Jamatia also said that Tipra-Motha is the best platform to serve their people and do something against decade long deprivation of their community and will preserve their constitutional rights.

Meanwhile, Pradyot Kishore reiterated that they will strengthen their movements for a hope to achieve the ‘greater Tipraland’ and if the government cannot give their rights, then they will do their best for their community after winning the elections. He said that till the constitutional rights for 13 lakh indigenous population, the Motha will not go for any political alliance with any political party before assembly election.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Vigilance awareness week celebrated at ONGC Tripura asset
tripura.description: Vigilance Awareness Week-2022 is celebrated from October 31st November 6th, 2022 with the theme of “Corruption Free India for a Developed Nation” at ONGC Tripura Asset.
tripura.content:
Vigilance Awareness Week-2022 is celebrated from October 31st November 6th, 2022 with the theme of "Corruption Free India for a Developed Nation" at ONGC Tripura Asset.

During the weeklong celebration various events, competitions were organized for employees, their family members and students of KV ONGC, Agartala such as poster making competition, quiz, and essay writing competition. A large response from all sections had been observed. The programme was inaugurated by. Sumit Sharan, IG of BSF,Tripura Frontier on October 31st in the presence of ONGC’s asset manager, Tarun Malik and senior officers. A talk was also delivered by Dr. U.K. Pandey, Former GGM-Head Corporate Vigilance on November 4th last.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: No voter to be left behind, awareness-based bicycle rally held in Agartala
tripura.description: A bicycle rally ‘Pedal for Participative Elections’ with the theme ‘No Voter To Be Left Behind’ was held in Agartala on Wednesday with the initiative of the office of the Chief Electoral Officer (CEO), Tripura.
tripura.content:
A bicycle rally ‘Pedal for Participative Elections’ with the theme ‘No Voter To Be Left Behind’ was held in Agartala on Wednesday with the initiative of the office of the Chief Electoral Officer (CEO), Tripura.

Chief Secretary J. K. Sinha, CEO, Tripura Kiran Gitte, West Tripura District Magistrate (DM) Debapriya Bardhan and other officials were present at the event. The rally started from Umakanta Academy Ground and moved around the city and ended back at Umakanta Academy Ground. Chief Secretary J. K. Sinha said, in order to participate in the election festival, it is necessary to enroll in the voter list. He urged everyone to spread this message to the young generation.

CEO Kiran Gitte said, the draft electoral roll of Tripura’s 60 constituencies has been published, according to the Election Commission of India (ECI) including the names of those who have turned 18 as on January 1, 2023. The commission aims that no voter should be left behind. This awareness rally is to generate awareness among the voters. He said, from today onwards, correction of names and transferring of voter lists shall be done on booth level at SDM office. He also said, those who are above 18 years of age as on April 1, July 1 and October 1 in 2023 may apply in advance for getting enrolled in the voter list. The participants were later handed over certificates at the end of the rally by the Election Commission.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: CEO, Tripura attended all party meeting before summary revision  of electoral rolls
tripura.description: Before the beginning of summary revision of electoral rolls from November 9th, 2022, the Election Commission of Indian (ECI) and the Chief Electoral Officer (CEO) of Tripura on Tuesday attended an all party meeting at the conference hall of Civil secretariat.
tripura.content:
Before the beginning of summary revision of electoral rolls from November 9th, 2022, the Election Commission of Indian (ECI) and the Chief Electoral Officer (CEO) of Tripura on Tuesday attended an all party meeting at the conference hall of Civil secretariat.

As per directives of the ECI, the state Election Department to undertake a special summary revision of photo electoral rolls with reference to January 1, 2023 as the qualifying date from November 9th.

While, as part of the preparations for 2023 assembly elections in Tripura, the ECI has already issued an order for Tripura that no officer connected directly with elections shall be allowed to continue in the present district of posting if they are posted in their home district for the past three years.

While, after the all party meeting, CEO Kiran Gitte speaking with media persons said that with reference to January 1, 2023 as the qualifying date for preparation of electoral rolls for 2023 assembly elections, the summary revision of rolls will start from November 9th. He said that ECI has taken initiatives and are working for 100% photo EPIC (Electoral photo identity card) and Aadhar linking of all voters.

He said that people who are eligible for casting of vote can enroll their names for EPIC through online and offline and the people who will complete their 18 years of age by January 1st, 2023 will be enrolled in the photo electoral rolls.

Gitte said that when Bru migrants are resettled in the designated spots, as soon as the ECI will start their enrollment in EPIC and ECI has also instructed for their 100% enrollment.

During the all party meeting, the representatives of all national and regional political parties including from IPFT, BJP, Congress, CPI, CPI(M), Trinamool Congress (TMC) and from Amra Bangalee participated in the meeting and they were briefed by Election department through PowerPoint presentation about summary revision of electoral rolls.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Manik Sarkar’s clarion calls to people to strengthen movements oust BJP govt
tripura.description: In his clarion call to the people of the state, opposition leader Manik Sarkar on Tuesday urged the people for a united fight against the BJP government to restore democracy in the state.
tripura.content:
In his clarion call to the people of the state, opposition leader Manik Sarkar on Tuesday urged the people for a united fight against the BJP government to restore democracy in the state.

Day after the 106th anniversary of ‘Great November Revolution’, opposition CPI(M) on Tuesday organized a hall meeting at Rabindra Satabarshiki Bhavan in Agartala and addressing the gathering, former Chief Minister and opposition leader Manik Sarkar through his scathing attacks on both central and state governments alleged that the condition of people are being deteriorating day by day during BJP rules and now people struggling to maintain their livelihood.

He said that after paralyzing all constitutional bodies of the country, the ruling BJP continued their attacks on common people and victimized the minority section of the society.

He urged his party supporters and leaders to unite the people against BJP-RSS’s ‘fascistic’ attacks on people and should strengthen their movements to restore democracy in the state.

"Only united fights and greater movements against the oppression politics of ruling parties is the need of the hour to give a relief to the people of Tripura from their violent politics," said Sarkar and added that the present condition should not be continued.

He said that ruling BJP totally failed to maintain their pre-poll commitments and asked where is the 50,000 jobs, central pay-scale for government employees?

"Our MLAs in all assembly sessions asked the treasury bench what is the number of vacant posts, but instead of filling vacant posts, they are increasing the unemployment rate day by day due to their anti-people policies," said Sarkar.

He also slammed the government for deprivation of retrenched 10, 323 teachers and applying of force on peaceful agitations by different unemployed groups. He said that the state BJP government during their 55 months rule continued the violent politics and false statements to divert the attention of people.

He also appealed to the people not to fall in the trap fetched by the ruling through their lucrative assurance before assembly polls and urged people to defeat BJP in the coming elections to restore peace and development in the state.

While, speaking in the meeting CPI(M) state secretary Jitendra Chowdhruy also urged the people of the state to strengthen their movements against the government and claimed not a people are happy over the functioning of government and every people are being deprived and affected by the ‘misrule’ of the state government.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Inhuman behavior by showroom owner to its employee, creates massive reaction, Pradyot urges police to take action
tripura.description: Protesting inhuman behavior and thrashing on an employee of the branded garment showroom located at Agartala by its owner, the Tipra-Motha supremo Pradyot Kishore Debbarma strongly condemned the incident and demanded immediate police action.
tripura.content:
Protesting inhuman behavior and thrashing on an employee of the branded garment showroom located at Agartala by its owner, the Tipra-Motha supremo Pradyot Kishore Debbarma strongly condemned the incident and demanded immediate police action.

On yesterday, the viral video of thrashing an employee by its owner inside garment showroom ‘Mufti’ in Agartala created massive reaction across the state over the barbaric attitude of the owner, who has beaten his employee through an iron rod.

Reacting over the incident Pradyot Kishore in his tweet message said "Attention@ Tripura-Police! @YTFTIPRA have already taken up this matter with you! We demand justice! It breaks my heart to see treatment like this given to anyone ! Kindly Take action or I will personally come down to your station with YTF warriors!".

Sources said that the shop owner of Agartala mercilessly beat his employee reportedly for demanding his salary. Incidentally, the owner is a Bengali and the employee is a tribal. The incident drew huge condemnation from various corners without considering the identity of the owner or the employee.

Police sources said that after receiving a complaint from the employee Surajit Tripura who hails from Chawmanu area of Dhalai district, police detained the owner of the shop Apu Saha and released him as the FIR had registered under section-325 of IPC, which jail provision of below seven years and as per the verdict of Supreme Court one accused person can arrest with such provisions.

Jayanta Kumar Day, Officer-in-Charge (OC) of West Agartala Police Station said the injury on the part of the complainant was minor in nature and the victim does not have any medical report from the hospital. The police are now investigating the matter seriously, he said.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Two Mizoram youths arrested with 1.21 lakh fake Indian currencies
tripura.description: In a special raid by Agartala city police on Tuesday, Indian fake currency of Rs. 1.21 lakh has been seized and two youths from neighbouring Mizoram state were also arrested.
tripura.content:
In a special raid by Agartala city police on Tuesday, Indian fake currency of Rs. 1.21 lakh has been seized and two youths from neighbouring Mizoram state were also arrested.

Giving details of the operation, SDPO(Sadar) Ajoy Kumar Das based on intelligence inputs, the police personnel from East Agartala police station and including himself laid a trap at the Inter-State Bus Terminal (ISBT) Chandrapur in plain clothes on Tuesday evening.

Based on the information, the police apprehended two youths moving in the bus stand and recovered fake Indian currency of total rupees 1.21 lakh in 500 denominations under their possession.

Das after preliminary interrogation, police arrested both youths identified as Gokul Kishore Chakma and Rajesh Chakma of Mamit district of Mizoram, who arrived in the capital city to deliver their consignment.

He said that during preliminary interrogation both arrested youths had revealed that they had collected these fake currencies from Assam state and they are part of an international gang involved in the fake currency racket. Das said that on Wednesday, they will be produced before a local court with police remand appeals for further interrogation.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Congress to start  “Bharat Jodo - Tripura Bacho Yatra” on Nov 19
tripura.description: As part of the nationwide programme, Tripura Pradesh Congress will also observe the “Bharat Jodo - Tripura Bacho Yatra” in all 60 assembly constituencies of the state  with an objective to ensure that the concerns and demands of the people reach Delhi.
tripura.content:
As part of the nationwide programme, Tripura Pradesh Congress will also observe the "Bharat Jodo - Tripura Bacho Yatra" in all 60 assembly constituencies of the state with an objective to ensure that the concerns and demands of the people reach Delhi.

Addressing a press conference here at Congress Bhavan on Monday afternoon PCC president Birajit Sinha said that on the birth anniversary of former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, the PCC will kick off the campaign simultaneously in 60 assembly segments of the state to highlight the misrule of the state government.

Sinha said that Congress MLA and former minister Sudip Roy Barman has been appointed as chairman of the campaign by AICC and PCC will have 16 sectors with 16 team leaders to organize the Yatra on the same day.

He said that on November 19 morning AICC general secretary and senior leader Joyram Ramesh will inaugurate the ‘Yatra’ in Agartala and state’s Congress in-charge Dr Ajoy Kumar will inaugurates the ‘Yatra’ in Dharmanagar and Kailasahar on the same days. Sinha added that few senior leaders and AICC secretaries will arrive in the state to participate in the campaign.

The Congress workers and all leaders will expedite their movements against ‘misrule’ of the BJP-IPFT government with the inauguration of “Bharat Jodo - Tripura Bacho Yatra” on November 19 and will strengthen its movements against oppression politics of BJP to oust the autocratic government in next assembly elections, said Sinha.
