"Bharat Jodo Yatra, in no way in any form, is a Mann Ki Baat. It is about the concern for people. Its objective is to ensure that the concerns and demands expressed by the people reach Delhi," he said in a dig at Prime Minister Narendra Modi's monthly radio broadcast.

also appealed to the people of the state to participate in the ‘Yatra’ to strengthen the Congress’s movements against the present state government.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Left parties observed November Revolution, D Raja lambasts BJP
tripura.description: Opposition CPI(M) along with other Left parties on Monday observed the 106th anniversary of ‘Great November Revolution’  by hoisting party flags , paying tributes to martyr columns and through rallies and street meetings.
tripura.content:
Opposition CPI(M) along with other Left parties on Monday observed the 106th anniversary of ‘Great November Revolution’ by hoisting party flags , paying tributes to martyr columns and through rallies and street meetings.

On Monday morning, CPI(M) polit Bureau member Hannan Molla hoisted the party flag at CPI(M) state’s headquarters in Agartala along with other state leaders. All the units of CPI(M) have also observed the day in their locality.

The Left Front alliance partner CPI also observed the day in Agartala, where D. Raja, general secretary of the Communist Party of India (CPI) participated in a rally at Agartala.

While, speaking with media persons D Raja highlighting the significance of the day said there was socialist revolution led by Lenin in Russia to fight against all kinds of exploitation, which inspired the movement across Indian and oppression politics of ruling BJP.

Criticizing the rule of Narendra Modi led BJP government Raja alleged that due to corporate appeasement policies of the central government, the economic structure of the country has collapsed and poor people are becoming poorer day by day.

He also alleged that BJP has created an environment of communal polarization and to defeat the BJP in coming days, the Left movements in Tripura will play an important role. He also appealed to all democratic and secular political parties to come into one platform to strengthen the fight against the BJP government. Raja added that to defeat the state’s BJP government CPI are actively working in its political arena and will also strengthen its movement against the BJP government.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: ECI issued instructions for transfer of officers
tripura.description: The Election Commission of India (ECI) issued a guideline for poll bound three states including Tripura, Meghalaya and Nagaland for transfer and posting of officers..
tripura.content:
The Election Commission of India (ECI) issued a guideline for poll bound three states including Tripura, Meghalaya and Nagaland for transfer and posting of officers.

The ECI said that the Commission has been following a consistent policy that officers directly connected with conduct of elections in an election-going state are not posted in their home districts or places where they have served for a considerably long period.

Hence, the Commission has decided that no officer connected directly with elections shall be allowed to continue in the present district of posting if they are posted in their home district and completed three years in that district during the last four years or would be completing 3 years on or before March 31s, 2023 .

The tenure of Tripura legislative assembly will end on March 22, 2023 and ECI will conduct the assembly elections before the expiry tenure of assembly.

Official sources said that the Commission will conduct the elections of three Northeastern states probably in the mid part of February, 2023 next and so a massive rejig in state administration has already started and all government officers will be transferred , who are in their present posting places for the last three years.

The ECI in its notification also said that while calculating the period of three years , promotion to a post within the district is to be counted. If any state with a few number of districts, face any difficulty in compliance of the instruction, then it may refer the specific case with reasons to the Commission through CEO for exemption and these instructions shall cover not only officers appointed for specific election duties like district election officers, returning officers, EROs and officers appointed as nodal officers etc.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Tipra-Motha’s big rally in Agartala on Nov 12, demonstration in New Delhi on Dec 1st
tripura.description: Regional Tipra-Motha will organize a large rally on November 12 next at Vivekananda stadium in Agartala in support of their demand for ‘Greater Tipraland’ constitutionally
tripura.content:
Regional Tipra-Motha will organize a large rally on November 12 next at Vivekananda stadium in Agartala in support of their demand for ‘Greater Tipraland’ constitutionally.

Addressing a press conference here at Rajbari, Tipra-Motha chairman Pradyot Kishore Debbarma said that altogether 2000 supporters of Motha will also march to New Delhi and will participate in a mass demonstration in front of ‘Jantan Mantar’ on December 1st in support of their ‘greater Tipraland’ demand.

He said that the November 12 rally in Agartala will be a great rally and Motha supporters from different parts of the state will participate in the peaceful rally in support of their demand.

While launching scathing attacks on the state government over the resettlement and rehabilitation process of all Bru migrants, Pradyot said that people never opposed the resettlement process of Bru migrants.

Refusing the statement made by the state government , Pradyot said that people are ready for resettlement in certain areas, but the government is providing lands in rubber plantations, which involve the livelihood of many people.

He alleged that the government wants to create a division among indigenous people and try to resettle Bru families in rubber plantations. He said that spots are being identified and Bru families are also ready to resettle in other areas, but government agencies are forcing them to resettle in rubber gardens, which has created protest among the local people.

Pradyot also said that he will file a case retrenched 10, 323 teachers in the Supreme Court for reinstatement of jobs on own expenses and renowned SC lawyer Kapil Sibal will fight for them. He said that after the November 12th rally, he will leave the state towards New Delhi for the case purpose.

He said that if the reinstatement of jobs is restored by the apex court, then the schools in villages will get teachers , which will directly benefit the spreading of education in rural areas of Tripura.

He also reiterated that Motha will not form any alliance with any other party till they are not assured or give written documents for ‘greater Tipraland’ and Motha will contest the next elections on its own capacity.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: “Khelo Tripura, Sustha Tripura” campaign,  1500 clubs to get sport accessories, Sushanta
tripura.description: With an aim to expand the “Khelo Tripura, Sustha Tripura” campaign to boost up the sporting activities across the state to achieve the goal of drug free Tripura, the government has initiated to give sports accessories to 1500 clubs of the state, said Sports and Youth Affairs Minister Sushanta Chowdhury.
tripura.content:
With an aim to expand the “Khelo Tripura, Sustha Tripura” campaign to boost up the sporting activities across the state to achieve the goal of drug free Tripura, the government has initiated to give sports accessories to 1500 clubs of the state, said Sports and Youth Affairs Minister Sushanta Chowdhury.

Speaking in the annual general meeting of Tripura School Sports Board held at the conference hall ‘Shiksha Bhava’ in Agartala on Saturday, the Minister said that with implementation of the "Khelo Tripura, Sustha Tripura" campaign, the department have ensure the mass campaign against drug menaces through collective ways.

We have to motivate the youths of the state against drug menaces in all blocks, subdivisions and in all districts of the state and the department is planning to mass programme for sporting activities along with cultural programmes in Agartala to boost up the campaign,", said Chowdhury.

He added that the Finance department has approved the plan of the Sports and Youth Affairs department to give sports accessories to 1500 clubs to promote sporting activities for encouraging healthy activities.

"We want to motivate the youths through clubs against drugs and for their active participation in sporting activities," said Chowdhury and added that sport related activities will play a key role to remove the drug menaces from society.

He said that all have to ensure that the drug free slogan of the state government should not consist into a slogan; rather it should be a reality to protect the next generations.

During the meeting, the general secretary of Tripura School Sports Board Paimong Mog through PowerPoint presentation highlighted the sporting activities held across the state in the financial year 2021-22 and also presented details over sports related activities going on in the present financial year.

As per the information provided in the meeting, a total of Rs. 1.74 crore amount has been spent in the state in the last financial year and an amount of Rs. 2.52 crore will be spent for development of Sports in the present financial year.

He said that sporting activities under the "Khelo Tripura, Sustha Tripura" campaign, has been started in many parts of the state and all competitions will be ended on December next and statewide final competition will be held in February next.

During the meeting Sports and Youth Affairs department secretary Dr Pradip Kumar Chakraborty and director Subikash Debbarma and district sport authorities were also present, who highlighted the activities of their respective districts.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Education Minister appeals  to retrenched teachers to end hunger strike
tripura.description: On the 17th day of the  “fast unto death” programme by a section of retrenched 10,323 teachers, the Education Minister Ratan Lal Nath on Saturday appealed to them to withdraw their hunger strike as the government trying to give them some relief to maintain their livelihood.
tripura.content:
On the 17th day of the "fast unto death"programme by a section of retrenched 10,323 teachers, the Education Minister Ratan Lal Nath on Saturday appealed to them to withdraw their hunger strike as the government trying to give them some relief to maintain their livelihood.

Education Minister Ratan Lal Nath addressing a press conference here at Civil Secretariat on Saturday evening to highlight offer of appointments of the department and fresh releases, said that he had a discussion with the Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha over the hunger strike of retrenched teachers and CM asked him to make an appeal towards the agitated teachers to withdraw their hunger strike .

Nath said that government humanitarian grounds are contemplating plans to give them relief and by December end, thousands more offers of appointments to be released.

"The present government does not believe in movements, but releasing offer after offer of appointment through legal process," said Nath and once again appeals to agitated teachers to withdraw their hunger strike.

Nath also said that the Education department has issued offers of appointment to 31 assistant professors for general degree colleges and 9 for Government Law College. He added that the government has issued postings to 453 teachers under the primary education department that include 248 graduate teachers, under graduate teacher 196, LDC 4 and Group D five.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Opposition leader Manik Sarkar visits home constituency
tripura.description: Opposition leader and MLA of Dhanapur assembly constituency  Manik Sarkar  on Saturday visited his home constituency after a gap of nearly one year.
tripura.content:
Opposition leader and MLA of Dhanapur assembly constituency Manik Sarkar on Saturday visited his home constituency after a gap of nearly one year.

Sarkar along with other leaders arrived at the CPI(M) party’s local committee member Kaushik Chanda's house whose residence was attacked 16 times in the last 55 months after formation of BJP-IPFT government. His unprecedented arrival encouraged many people in the area to rush and to have a glimpse of their MLA and urge him to visit more frequently.

Sarkar, last visited Kathalia one year ago when the whole area suffered massive political violence and pitch-battle among supporters of two political parties.

Speaking with media persons Sarkar said that he did not visit his home constituency Dhanapur keeping in mind the overall safety of party supporters. However, public opinion is gradually gaining momentum against the autocratic ruler and the defeat of the ruler is only a matter of time, said Sarkar and added that people through their united fight will definitely oust the BJP government in next assembly elections.

Why are they being attacked again and again? Is it a crime as they are the supporters of CPI(M) , asked Sarkar and that people don't accept the violent politics of BJP and they will not tolerate them in coming days and soon the rules of autocratic rulers will come to end.

He appeals to all people to strengthen their united movements against the government and should also resist the violent politics of the ruling party.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: BJP-CPM clash, six injured in Teliamura
tripura.description: At least six persons including two police personnel sustained injuries after a clash among the supporters of ruling BJP and opposition CPI(M) erupted at Korailong School Chowmuhani area  of Teliamura subdivision under Khowai district on Saturday evening, which created massive tension in that area.
tripura.content:
At least six persons including two police personnel sustained injuries after a clash among the supporters of ruling BJP and opposition CPI(M) erupted at Korailong School Chowmuhani area of Teliamura subdivision under Khowai district on Saturday evening, which created massive tension in that area.

Sources said that a car has been ransacked during a pitch-battle among supporters of both parties and at least six workers of both parties were admitted to local hospital.

Sources added that the clash took place when two processions of the rival parties came face to face on Saturday evening, while the CPI(M) was organising a road side meeting and the BJP was organising a procession. Clash started as both the sides came face to face. Both the sides alleged each other for the clash . Immediately , police forces rushed to the spot and brought the situation under control.

However, additional forces have also been deployed in the area after escalating tension.

Opposition CPI(M) organized the street meeting in support of SFI’s rally in Teliamura on November 9th next students and they alleged that the attack was committed by BJP workers to vandalise the street meeting . On the other hand the local BJP MLA Kalyani Roy said that CPI(M)’s unprovoked attack proves how they are trying to vitiate the atmosphere in the area before the ensuing assembly election. BJP also filed a complaint and demanded immediate police action.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Holy Cross School, Agartala celebrates golden Jubilee
tripura.description: Holy Cross School Agartala inaugurated the Jubilee year in 2020, but unfortunately, all the celebrations had to be muted because of the COVID-19 Pandemic.
tripura.content:
Holy Cross School Agartala inaugurated the Jubilee year in 2020, but unfortunately, all the celebrations had to be muted because of the COVID-19 Pandemic.

However, the concluding event of the Golden Jubilee celebration was so mesmerizing that the wait time was worth it. It was quite a family affair where members of the Holy Cross fraternity met, admiring and acknowledging its growth as a mammoth learning hub. All the dignitaries, on occasion, were closely connected to Holy Cross.

Chief Guest Bishop Lumen Monteiro, CSC, Bishop of Agartala, Guest of Honour Bishop Stephen, CSC, Bishop of Aizawl and a host of other dignitaries, including past principals, Vice Principals, administrators and Headmistresses, teachers, and alumni witnessed over 1000 students performing simultaneously on three stages. Apart from students, Teachers, parents, and alumni also added colour to the occasion through their enthralling performance. During the occasion, the school also felicitated Principals, Vice principals, Headmistresses, teachers, and the first batch of students.

As this mammoth learning hub looks back with measured pride on the 50-plus years of its history, there is a great sense of satisfaction. The school gratefully acknowledges the founding Holy Cross fathers and the fathers who held the helm tight to date, the Bethany sisters who worked and continue to walk alongside, the dedicated teachers, instrumental in educating and forming multitudes of dignified human persons through Holy Cross, and of course the support staff, the silent workforce that keeps the ball rolling daily.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Agriculture is the main factor for rural economy: CM
tripura.description: Farmers are the  friends of the society and they are the bread-winners of the country and their socio- economic development will ensure welfare of the society, said Chief Minister Dr. Manik Saha after inaugurating Farmer Knowledge Centre at Sekerkote  area under West Tripura district Thursday.
tripura.content:
Farmers are the friends of the society and they are the bread-winners of the country and their socio- economic development will ensure welfare of the society, said Chief Minister Dr. Manik Saha after inaugurating Farmer Knowledge Centre at Sekerkote area under West Tripura district Thursday.

He said, the central and the state government have taken various plans for farmers’ welfare under the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi. This Farmer Knowledge Centre will be playing the role of an education institution for the farmers. It is to be noted that the Knowledge Centre has facilities to provide training to 30 farmers through audio-visual. The farmers will be able to attain information related to producing crops and different problems at the centre and take suggestions.

The Chief Minister said, farmers will be able to attain knowledge on increasing crop production, marketing of produced crops etc., at the centre. He also said, agriculture is the main factor for the rural economy. After the present government took over, farmers’ income has almost doubled. That will increase in the future. He said, the farmers are given their respect in the period of the present government. Everyone must be aware of the importance of self-reliant India and self- reliant Tripura. The nation and state will become self-reliant if the farmers prosper. He said, the state government aims to build about 83 Farmer Knowledge Centres in future, one in each agriculture sector offices of the state. Welcome speech was delivered by Secretary of Agriculture and Farmers’ Welfare department Apurba Roy. Sabhadhipati of West Tripura Zilla Parishad Antara Sarkar Deb, Vice Chairman of Dukli Panchayat Samiti Dulal Sarkar also spoke in the programme.

Vote of thanks was delivered by Director of Agriculture and Farmers’ Welfare department Saradindu Das.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Deputy CM inaugurates new building of Dumburnagar RD Block
tripura.description: The ‘Gandatwisa’ sub-division will soon be turned into model sub-division in the state through overall development including development in tourism sector, said Deputy Chief Minister Jishnu Dev Varma after inaugurating the new building complex of Dumburnagar RD Block Office at Gandatwisa in Dhalai district on Thursday.
tripura.content:
The ‘Gandatwisa’ sub-division will soon be turned into model sub-division in the state through overall development including development in tourism sector, said Deputy Chief Minister Jishnu Dev Varma after inaugurating the new building complex of Dumburnagar RD Block Office at Gandatwisa in Dhalai district on Thursday.

He said developmental works would accelerate if women involved themselves more in social activities. That is why it is important to boost women empowerment through involvement in SHGs and other projects in the rural areas. Member of Parliament (MP) Rebati Tripura, TTAADC EM Rajesh Tripura, MDC Bhumika Nanda Reang, Dhalai DM Dr. Sidharth Shiv Jaiswal, Managing Director of OTPC, Palatana Project Sannnil C. Namboordiripad, Chief Engineer RD Sapan Das were present in the inaugural programme.

MP Rebati Tripura spoke on various ongoing and upcoming developmental projects in Dhalai district which is recognized as an aspirational district. He informed that a connectivity project of National Highway Gandatwisa-Kamalpur via Ambassa shall start soon after it gets approved by the Ministry of Transport and National Highways, Government of India. He also expressed his gratitude to the state government that the construction work of Town Hall is steadily progressing and is likely to complete by December this year.

Financial assistance of Rs. 3 lakh was handed over to three local Self-Help Groups (SHGs) during the programme by the guests. The Deputy Chief Minister along with other guests also launched ‘Mobile Medical Unit Van’ sponsored by OTPC, Palatana Project.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Suspected thief lynched at Kamalpur
tripura.description: In another lynching incident ,  a group of irate mob of Nagbangshi Village in Kamalpur subdivison under Dhalai District lynched one suspected thief identified Sahid Mian on Wednesday night.
tripura.content:
In another lynching incident , a group of irate mob of Nagbangshi Village in Kamalpur subdivison under Dhalai District lynched one suspected thief identified Sahid Mian on Wednesday night.

After the incident was reported police rushed to the spot and shifted the body to Kamalpur hospital for autopsy.

Police sources said that the incident started when the villagers found that Sahid Mian (28), a resident of Kamalpur Sadar was roaming in the village at around 1 AM in the midnight. He could not give any explanation for why he was going to Nagbangshi village in the midnight and villagers started thrashing him indiscriminately and killing him on the spot.

People were very much aggrieved as in recent time several stolen incidents were held at their village and police added that the victim youth was also involved in suspected stolen incidents , who was summoned by the local police station for interrogation.

There were several cases of lynching in the state on various reasons in the past. In recent times it was the first case of lynching and police had registered a specific case and started investigation to unearth the actual reason for lynching.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Miscreants set fire on two BJP offices in South Tripura
tripura.description: Amidst political tension in different parts of the state, in a provocative incident , two party offices of BJP in Satmura and bordering Amzadnagar area under Belonia subdivision of South Tripura district were ransacked and burnt down on Wednesday  by unknown miscreants .
tripura.content:
Amidst political tension in different parts of the state, in a provocative incident , two party offices of BJP in Satmura and bordering Amzadnagar area under Belonia subdivision of South Tripura district were ransacked and burnt down on Wednesday by unknown miscreants .

Sources said that when the both incidents were noticed on Thursday, tension spread in both areas and a large number of police forces were also deployed in these areas to defuse the escalating tension.

Sources said that last night there was a cultural programme at Satmura area on the 50th anniversary of the local New Star Club and there were a lot of people. But as soon as the function had ended the Satmura BJP office went up in flames after its ransacking by unknown miscreants. Subsequently, another BJP office in the bordering Amzadnagar area was also burnt down.

Sources said that, though political strength of opposition CPI (M) and Congress in both areas are so weak, the local people ruled out any subversive activities by opposition parties.

Local sources added that none of the local people saw anyone setting the offices on fire and there has been no arrest even if police and firefighters reached the area in time.

However local sources said that there is nobody in this area to set the BJP offices afire and these provocative activities happened because of serious infighting in BJP between the ousted BJP ‘Mandal’ president Ashesh Baidya and the incumbent Mandal president Sushankar Bhowmik.

The vice president of the ‘Mandal’ Badal Bhowmik blamed the arsoning on the CPI (M) cadres and alleged that the Communist were trying to destabilize the peace in their locality because of the ensuing assembly election.

Police sources said that they started investigation over the both arsoning cases and deployed a large number of security forces to avoid any kind of political tension.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: DYFI observed foundation day, attack in a blood donation camp
tripura.description: The 43rd foundation day of the Left youth organization Democratic Youth Federation of India (DYFI) was observed across the state through rallies, voluntary blood donation camps and street meetings. But, the observation of the day also witnessed political clashes among the supporters of both ruling BJP and opposition CPI(M).
tripura.content:
The 43rd foundation day of the Left youth organization Democratic Youth Federation of India (DYFI) was observed across the state through rallies, voluntary blood donation camps and street meetings. But, the observation of the day also witnessed political clashes among the supporters of both ruling BJP and opposition CPI(M).

On Thursday morning opposition leader Manik Sarkar inaugurated a blood donation camp at Bardowali CPI(M) office in Agartala organized by the Dukli divisional committee of DYFI, where about 50 blood units were donated by the youth activities. In the evening, hundreds of DYFI activists organized a torch bearing procession in Agartala, which passed through different thoroughfares of Agartala city.

But, in the morning during observance of the day through a voluntary blood donation camp held at the house of CPI(M) Belonia subdivisional committee secretary Tapash Datta in Belonia, miscreants attacked his house and ransacked his house properties. Miscreants had also started stone pelting targeting the houses and entire tin made boundary walls of the house ransacked.

After the incident was reported, police forces rushed to the and tried to defuse the tension. While, when DYFI workers resumed their blood donation camp, agin miscreants led some local BJP leaders arrived at the spot and tried to attack again. But, a large number of DYFI workers defying all threat and intimidation continued the blood donation programme and when they received united resistance , escaped from the spot.

Speaking with media persons, CPI(M) leader Tapash Datta alleged that local BJP leader Ashesh Baidya led the attack on his house and it’s a shame for the ruling party that they are not allowing humanitarian activities like voluntary blood donation camp.

He said that CPI(M) workers tolerated them enough, now time has come to resist the violent politics of ruling BJP and they will continue their social activities and will resist miscreants unitedly.

Opposition leader Manik Sarkar also strongly condemned the attack at Tapash Datta’s house and claimed that the police act was impartial.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Drug peddler arrested by city police with Yaba, Heroine
tripura.description: TBased on secret information, the Agartala city police has arrested a noted drug peddler and recovered large quantities of contraband items under his possession.
tripura.content:
Based on secret information, the Agartala city police has arrested a noted drug peddler and recovered large quantities of contraband items under his possession.

Giving details of the operation, SDPO(Sadar) Ajoy Kumar Das said that on Wednesday midnight based on the secret information, the OC of West Agartala police station, Jayanta Kumar Dey raided the house of one Shankar Sarkar in bordering Lankamura area.

In the course of the search operation, police recovered large quantities of Yaba tablets and suspected Heroin under his possession. Police also seized a TVS scooty, which was used for transportation of the drug consignment.

Das said that drug peddler Shankar Debnath has been arrested under Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act, 1985 (NDPS Act) case and has also been forwarded to a local court with police remand appeals to interrogate him. He said that during interrogation, a police investigating team will unearth the supply chain and money train of the narcotic smugglers active in the capital city and will burst their racket.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: CM to inaugurate NE regional security coordination meet on Nov 8 at Agartala
tripura.description: Tripura to host first time two days Northeast Regional Security Coordination conference in Agartala on November 8th and 9th next, the  Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha will inaugurate the conference, which would be attended by all DGPs of the NE states along with  heads of central police organizations and central armed police forces of the region.
tripura.content:
Tripura to host first time two days Northeast Regional Security Coordination conference in Agartala on November 8th and 9th next, the Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha will inaugurate the conference, which would be attended by all DGPs of the NE states along with heads of central police organizations and central armed police forces of the region.

Chief Minister in his 'Rashtriya Ekta Diwas' speech in AD Nagar police ground on Monday last , said that for the first, the DGP conference for all Northeastern states will be held in the state on November 8th and 9th next.

Official sources said that Joint Secretary in the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA), officials from central intelligence agencies are also scheduled to be present in the regional security meet.

Sources added that during the regional security meet, the authorities will discuss issues to enhance coordination among the security agencies - both Central and state on security matters. Insurgency, border related issues including drug menace, trans-border crime and sharing of intelligence inputs are among the top agenda of the meeting.

The regional security meet is seen as important keeping in mind the growing security concern along the international border with China, Myanmar and Bangladesh.

Anti-Indian forces are still active across the border to create unrest in the Northeast. Be it arms smuggling or drug supply or circulation of fake Indian currency notes and insurgency - all originated from the neighbouring countries and these issues will come up for discussion in the conference and find a solution to tackle the growing situation.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: 92% PMAY houses got free electricity connections, RD Dept
tripura.description: ITripura government has provided free electricity connection at 92% houses made under Prime Minister Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana(PMAY) scheme across the state.
tripura.content:
Tripura government has provided free electricity connection at 92% houses made under Prime Minister Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana(PMAY) scheme across the state.

Addressing a press conference here at Civil Secretariat on Wednesday afternoon, the special secretary of Rural Development department Dr Sandip R Rathore said that the government has also ensured drinking water supply to 77% houses made under PMAY scheme, toilet facilities 87 % and 77 % houses were also equipped with LPG connections.

Giving details of the success of the state over implementation of the PMAY scheme, the state government had received the sanction of 2, 28,411 houses in the last financial year.

He said that prior to the financial year 2018-19, the sanctioned houses were 24,989 and in the financial year 2021-22, the sanctioned houses were 2,28,411. The government expenditures to complete the large number of houses since April last year till date, a total of Rs. 2061.80 crore have been spent.

Giving details over Tripura Rural Livelihood Mission (TRLM), the special secretary said that during financial year 2022-23, a total of 489 vacant contractual positions are already filled up under the mission and for social and economic empowerment of women, in 2022-23, TRLM has mobilized around 63,808 women from rural poor families into 7,696 Self Help Groups (SHGs) and initiatives are being taken for augmenting their livelihood.

In the FY 2022-23, around 4214 SHGs have been provided Revolving Fund (RF) for Rs. 4.59 crore and 2536 SHGs have been provided Community Investment Fund (CIF) for Rs. 31.92 crore, said Rathore and to augment the livelihood activities of women SHG members, Rs.120.18 crore bank loans have already been mobilized to women SHGs in the same financial year. Significantly, the NPA rate on SHG bank loans is only around 2.1%.

He said that under ‘Shyama Prasad Mukherjee Rurban Mission’, altogether 136 numbers of projects have been completed in this scheme and expenditure incurred is Rs. 377.64 crore.

He said that transformation of the aspirational block programme was launched in 12 backward tribal blocks during 2019 with the aim to improve the service delivery to 44 key priority indicators involving 9 departments with main thrust to that a;; departments shall ensure 8 to 10% of higher allocation of in those identified blocks. At present the programme is being implemented by all the concerned departments which is being regularly reviewed by the DMs for progress of the mission.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Govt to open pharmacies in GB, IGM hospitals, medicines with affordable prices
tripura.description: In order to expand the health services, the Health department will open two pharmacy shops in GB and IGM hospital complexes and will provide medicine to the patients’ affordable prices.
tripura.content:
In order to expand the health services, the Health department will open two pharmacy shops in GB and IGM hospital complexes and will provide medicine to the patients’ affordable prices.

Addressing a press conference here at Civil Secretariat on Tuesday afternoon, the secretary of Health department, Dr Debasish Basu said that the new initiatives of the department will give enormous benefits to the patients. He said that as the government committed to protect the health of the state’s people, the department working round the clock to extend the health services to the remotest corner of the state.

At present, the state has 6 state hospitals, six district hospitals, 14 subdivisional, 21 community health centres, 118 primary health centres, 999 sub-health centres, 14 blood banks including two private run and six more blood component separation units with 7 blood storage centres, Dr Basu.

Highlighting the modern and sophisticated health care services of the state government hospitals, Dr Basu said new CT-Scan machines will also be installed at GB and IGM Hospitals.

He said that with amendment of Tripura Health Service rules in 2022, the number of medical officer cadre has been increased from 1480 to 2170 along with categorization for general duty medical officers and Specialist cadre.

While mentioning the functioning of a new multi-storey building in IGM Hospital complex, Dr Basu said that the Eye and Pathology departments of the hospital has been shifted to the new building complex.

The department has also upgraded and equipped many primary health centres into round the clock health care providers, said Dr Basu and added that the department has continued its effort to curb the menaces for HIV/AIDS through awareness camps , which is spreading by the injectable drug users.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Main accused involved in Kalyanpur gang rape still untraced, two prime investigating officers transferred
tripura.description: Amidst continuous protest by opposition parties issuing gang rape incidents of Kalyanpur and Kumarghat, the state police after passing of seven days still unable to arrest main accused.
tripura.content:
Amidst continuous protest by opposition parties issuing gang rape incidents of Kalyanpur and Kumarghat, the state police after passing of seven days still unable to arrest main accused.

Sources said that when the main accuse and Upa-Pradhan of West Dharikapur Gram Panchayat, Bidhan Bihari Datta and another accused Ratna Debnath are in the run, the additional SP of Khowai district Rajdeep Deb and officer-in-charge (OC) of Kalyanpur police station Uddam Debbarma were transferred.

Sources though said that as part per-election transfer, both officers were transferred, but with concrete efforts of both these transferred officer among four gang rape accused, police till today were able two accused.

It may be recalled here on October 25th night, a minor tribal girl, who was returning home after attending cultural programme with her friends from Kash Kalyanpur area of West Dharikapur , was allegedly obstructed by few youths and snatched her mobile phone, they kidnapped her and gang-raped her night long.

Kalyanpur police station registered the case under section 376,341,325,354,392, 34 of IPC and section -4 of POCSO Act and started investigation. Police within 24-hours of the incident arrested one prime accused Tapash Debnath . Officer-in-charge (OC) of Kalyanpur police station and SDPO(Teliamura) Prasun Tripura said that an FIR has been registered against four persons including Aditya Das, Tapash Debnath, Ratan Debnath and Bidhan Datta.

Day after the incident on October 26, police had arrested one accused Tapash Debnath and on October 27 had also arrested another accused identified as Aditya Das, who is in five days police custody.

After statewide protest and demonstration after gang rape of minor girl and involvement of ruling party supporters, the police led by SDPO(Kalyanpur) Prasun Kanti Tripura had also organized peace meeting in the Kalyanpur police station in presence of representatives of different political parties.

Police sources said that based on interrogation statements of arrested two miscreants Tapash Debnath and Aditya Das, police have arrested two more persons including a SPO jawan Digendra Debnath and Nibash Debnath for giving shelter to one of the prime accused Ratan Debnath. Both arrested persons were produced before a local court with 3-days police remand appeals and court sent them in jail custody.

Amidst apprehension to divert the investigation process with transfer of two prominent officers associated with the investigation, SDPO Prasun Kanti Tripura said that with transfer these officers , the present investigation of the gang rape case will not be affected and soon police will able to arrest two other accused involved in the incident. He added that they launched a massive manhunt to arrest two other miscreants and raids have been continuing in their possible hideouts.

The incident came days after another teenager was allegedly gang raped in Unakoti district, with the opposition claiming that a state minister's son was involved in the crime.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Pre-election rejig: 134 civil, police officers transferred
tripura.description: Amidst spree of transfer from Civil and Police administration as part of the pre-election rejig, altogether 14 senior TCS, IAS officers, nine TPS officers and 111 in-charge Sub-Inspectors (SI) of police were transferred in different notifications.
tripura.content:
Amidst spree of transfer from Civil and Police administration as part of the pre-election rejig, altogether 14 senior TCS, IAS officers, nine TPS officers and 111 in-charge Sub-Inspectors (SI) of police were transferred in different notifications.

The General Administration (personnel and Training) department of state government through a notification has transferred 14 TCS super-selection grade officers including an IAS officer. Among the prominent transferred officers Ashim Saha, incumbent ADM of West Tripura was transferred as new ADM for South Tripura district, Moslem Uddin Ahmed, ADM of Dhalai district as new director of Fisheries and Devananda Reang incumbent director of Panchayat and Fisheries departments has been relieved from the charges of director of Fisheries.

The present director of Tourism Tarit Kanti Chakma (IAS) will hold the additional charge as ADM for West Tripura district.

In another notification, the General Administration has transferred 9 TPS grade- I and II officers including Sabyasachi Debnath from Crime Branch to SDPO(Mohanpur), Kamal Krishna Kalai from SDPO(MOhanpur) to Dy.SP(West), incumbent additional SP(West) Anirban Das as additional SP of Khowai district replacing Rajdeep Deb, who will hold the new charges as additional SP(West). Among transferred police officers SDPO (Sonamura) charge has been given to Samir Roy and SDPO (Kamalpur) given to Banuj Biplab Das etc.

In the third transfer order issued by police headquarters has transferred altogether 111 in-charge Sub-Inspectors (SIs) from district to district, who were recently promoted to police SI from Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI).

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Rashtriya Ekta Diwas observed with patriotic fervour
tripura.description: Tripura along with other parts of the country observed the 'Rashtriya Ekta Diwas' on Monday , the birth anniversary of leading freedom fighter and independent India's first Home Minister Sardar Vallavbhai Patel.
tripura.content:
Tripura along with other parts of the country observed the 'Rashtriya Ekta Diwas' on Monday , the birth anniversary of leading freedom fighter and independent India's first Home Minister Sardar Vallavbhai Patel. The day starts with ‘Run for Unity' in the morning from Swamy Vivekananda stadium to Umakanta Academy ground.

The unity run was flagged off by the Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha, who also participated in the unity run along with his cabinet colleagues and government officials.

Later, in the afternoon the state level main programme was held at Monoranjan Debbarma Smriti stadium in AD Nagar police lines, where Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha participated in the pledge taking ceremony before a ceremonial parade of police and other security forces. During the pledge taking ceremony different bands of security forces performed in the programme by playing patriotic songs.

After the pledge taking ceremony, Chief Minister addressing the gathering said that the motto of Prime Minister Narendra Modi ‘Ek Bharat, Shreshtra Bharat’ has been inspired from Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel and his contribution of Patel for a united India, the people of the country will never forget.

He said that on Monday foundation stone for construction of a statue of Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel has been laid at the joining point of Deo and Manu rivers in Unakoti district, which will cost Rs. 50 lakh.

While highlighting the improved law and order situation of the state, Dr Saha said that during the last four and half years due to concrete efforts of state police, the overall law and order situation improved.

There are insurgency related activities in Tripura and state police along with other central forces are continuing their efforts to combat any kind of insurgency related activities on the state's soil.

As per the National Crime Record Bureau’s data published in 2021, Tripura is ranked in 5th position among all 28 states for least crime rate and the government with high importance are curbing the crime against women, said Dr Saha and added that to ensure the women security, a 24-hours help desk are working in police stations in all seven women police stations of the state. He said that another new women police station at Khowai will start functioning.

Dr Saha added that from 2018 to 2022, altogether 1,776 NDPS Act cases were registered across the state and 2700 persons were arrested with seizure of huge quantities of contraband items including cannabis, Yaba tablets, cough syrups, Heroine etc. Many cases are being investigated by SIT and Union Home Minister Amit Shah praised the efforts of the state government in the recently concluded NEC meeting at Guwahati. The Chief Minister also said that for the first, the DGP conference for all Northeastern states will be held in the state on November 8th and 9th next.

During the state level programme , Chief Secretary J K Sinha and DGP Amitabh Ranjan along with top police officials were also present.

Apart from these, all the central security forces including BSF, CRPF and Assam Rifles deployed in the state observed the day with patriotic fervour to commemorate the Rashtriya Ekta Diwas, commemorated in a befitting manner. Officers, SOs, Jawans of CRPF Tripura Sector participated in pledge taking ceremony followed by 'Run for Unity' from Swami Vivekananda Stadium to Umakanta Academy similarly, Officers, JCOs and jawans of GC Agartala ,71, 124,140 and 225 battalions participated in "Run for Unity" in their respective areas of responsibility followed by pledge taking ceremony with full zeal and enthusiasm.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Congress remembered Indira Gandhi, attacks in 3 places
tripura.description: Along with the entire nation, Tripura Pradesh Congress on Monday also remembered former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi on her 38th death anniversary across the state, but during the observance of the day clashes erupted among the supporters of ruling BJP and Congress.
tripura.content:
Along with the entire nation, Tripura Pradesh Congress on Monday also remembered former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi on her 38th death anniversary across the state, but during the observance of the day clashes erupted among the supporters of ruling BJP and Congress.

Congress leaders and workers including former Chief Minister Samir Ranjan Barman, former PCC president Gopal Roy and senior leader Ashish Kumar Saha in Agartala paid floral tributes before a portrait of Indira Gandhi in front of Congress Bhavan on Monday morning and have also paid floral tributes at the Gandhi Ghat memorial place.

Congress also observed the birth anniversary of Sardar Vallabhai Patel in Congress Bhavan and in all districts of the state, where leaders of the party paid their floral tributes before the portraits of Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel and Indira Gandhi.

Reports said that when Congress workers observed the anniversary of the former prime Minister, a group of miscreants attacked different venues, ransacked and physically assaulted a few Congress workers.

The Congress workers in 14-Badharghat assembly constituency have prepared for mass food distribution on Monday morning to mark the days and they prepared all food items and stored them in their party office. When Congress workers on Monday morning arrived at the spot to start cooking, they found all of the raw food items were stolen away and the entire spot had been ransacked by unknown miscreants.

In two other incidents, in GB Bazar and Indranagar Kali Bari areas under 6-Agartala assembly constituency, a group of miscreants attacked and ransacked all Congress decorations to observe the death anniversary of Indira Gandhi. When Congress started distribution of food items at GB Bazar area, a motorbike laden group arrived at the spots and started beating Congress workers.

Then miscreants arrived at Indranagar Kali Bari area and had also ransacked party decorations and physically assaulted some old Congress supporters. Protesting both incidents, Congress workers blockaded that main road for hours.

Later, police arrived at the spot and assured that they will take legal action against accused persons, then agitated Congress workers withdrew their road blockade programme.

Congress leaders alleged that miscreants owing allegiance with ruling BJP attacks in both places and when they were committing attacks, police personnel were present in the GB Bazar incident and became silent spectators.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Two days TWJA’s conference, Workshop ends
tripura.description: The two days long annual conference and workshop by Tripura Working Journalist Association (TWJA) held at Bhagat Singh Youth hostel in Agartala concluded on Sunday.
tripura.content:
The two days long annual conference and workshop by Tripura Working Journalist Association (TWJA) held at Bhagat Singh Youth hostel in Agartala concluded on Sunday.

On Sunday morning at 9 AM, the educational workshop started, where veteran journalists from Kolkata Mrs. Snigdha Mitra Mukherjee and Mrs. Jumur Datta Gupta participated in the inaugural part of the workshop to highlight different issues on journalism.

Later, in the workshop the Member secretary Tripura State Legal Services Authority (TSLSA), Sanjoy Bhattacharjee and director of Tripura AIDS Control Society (TACS) Dr Shankar Das highlighted the growing drug menaces across Tripura and rule of media persons to curb the menace.

Through informatics discussion, Dr Shankar Das sharing his long years experiences in medical service across Tripura elaborated how the injectable drug users became easy victims of HIV and AIDS infections.

He also gave a detailed discussion over the rule of media persons to spread awareness over growing drug menace and over concrete rule of media persons to control the drug trafficking and its smuggling network.

After lunch break, the SP of West Tripura district Shankar Debnath in presence of TWJA’s president Dhruba Ranjan Sen through interactive speech highlighted the moral policing and also shared his views with participating journalists and photo-journalists over cordial relationship with police and media for better society.

During the two days programme, journalists and photo-journalists from all districts and different subdivisions of the state participated. Later, in the concluding part of the two days session, TWJA has formed a five members Women Cell, said general secretary of TWJA Sunil Debnath.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: CM thanks PM for highlighting Tripura’s bio-village project in Maan Ki Baat
tripura.description: Chief Minister Manik Saha extended his gratitude towards the  Prime Minister Narendra Modi for highlighting Tripura's bio-village project  in his monthly ‘Mann Ki Baat' radio broadcast on Sunday.
tripura.content:
Chief Minister Manik Saha extended his gratitude towards the Prime Minister Narendra Modi for highlighting Tripura's bio-village project in his monthly ‘Mann Ki Baat' radio broadcast on Sunday.

Tripura Renewable Energy Development Authority (TREDA) in association with the Bio-Technology department of the state established the country's first bio-village at Daspara, in Sepahijala district, about 25 km from here.

After hearing the ‘Mann ki Baat’ programme at his constituency in the Town Bardowali area of Agartala, the Chief Minister speaking with media persons said that the Prime Minister was highlighting and promoting the state's first bio-village on which work had started around two years ago. The concept of bio-village is environment-friendly, water pumps for irrigation and lighting systems are solar-powered.

He said all the families living in the state’s first bio-village are fulfilling their power requirement through solar energy.

The Prime Minister in the radio programme on Sunday made a special reference to the successful implementation of the concept of bio-village in the northeastern state and applauded the efforts by the authorities.

Non-renewable sources of energy can be beneficial for remote areas of the state as transporting electrical energy is costly and not economically viable, the chief minister said.

The Chief Minister in his tweet said that "I wholeheartedly thank Hon’ble PM Shri Narendra Modi Ji for highlighting Tripura’s Biol village project in his popular programme Maan Ki Baat. The recognition by the Prime Minister is a source of encouragement for the people of Tripura."

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Noted gang member of thieves arrested by city police, goods stolen from doctor chamber recovered
tripura.description: The Agartala city police once again arrested a member of a thieves gang and recovered stolen items under his possession on Sunday.
tripura.content:
The Agartala city police once again arrested a member of a thieves gang and recovered stolen items under his possession on Sunday.

Giving details SDPO (Sadar) Ajoy Kumar Das on the Diwali night, a gang of thieves raided the chamber of renowned Diabetologist Dr Mridul Das and stole all valuable items and raided his house. Suspected thieves have also stolen away some high value phones from his house.

After the incident was reported, police personnel from East Agartala police station started investigation and recovered all CCTV footage of the house and chamber. Based on the information found in CCTV footage, police detained some suspected thieves, but among them arrested one noted thief identified as Deep Bhattcharjee, who was a gang leader of thieves.

Police team also recovered some stolen items under his possession and forwarded him in a local court with police remand appeal for further interrogation.

Das said that after detailed interrogation, they will be able to recover other stolen items and other members of the gang involved in the stolen incident.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: 167 police officers transferred district to district
tripura.description: Just few months before the ensuing assembly elections, the police administration in a major administrative reshuffle order has transferred altogether 167 police officers in different districts of the state.
tripura.content:
Just few months before the ensuing assembly elections, the police administration in a major administrative reshuffle order has transferred altogether 167 police officers in different districts of the state.

Tripura police headquarters on Sunday in a major transfer order signed by DGP Amitabh Ranjan has transferred 44 police inspectors and 123 Sub-Inspectors (SIs) of police department from their present posting district to another district.

Among the transferred police officers many prominent police Inspectors, who were recently promoted from SI to in-charge inspectors from different police stations located in Agartala were transferred to different districts of the state. Among 123 police sub-inspectors (SIs), many who were also recently promoted from ASI to SI were also transferred and posted from their present posting districts to other districts of the state.

Earlier, the state police administration and General Administration of the state government had also transferred senior level officers as part of the pre-election transfer of officers.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: CBSF cycle rally to be flagged off on Nov 1st
tripura.description: Border Security Force, besides performing the primary task of safeguarding and  defending the frontiers of the country round the clock, is also actively involved in conducting activities which promote solidarity and sportsmanship.
tripura.content:
Border Security Force, besides performing the primary task of safeguarding and defending the frontiers of the country round the clock, is also actively involved in conducting activities which promote solidarity and sportsmanship.

On November 1st a ‘Cycle Rally’ will be flagged off from Integrated Check Post (ICP), Agartala, and after going all along the borders in Tripura, Mizoram, Cacher frontier, Meghalaya, Guwahati, North Bengal, South Bengal will be terminating on 12th Dec 2022 at Tagorevilla in Kolkata.

BDF sources said that the objective of this ‘Cycle Rally’ is to promote the spirit of comradeship, and sportsmanship among the troops and strengthen the bond between the border population and enhance mutual cooperation, coordination and trust thereby creating a sense of security and confidence amongst the border population.

BSF Tripura is also organising various programs in bordering areas to felicitate the cyclist by involving the local state Officials, school children and border population for better coordination and understanding.

The cycle rally will be flagged-off by Sumit Sharan, , IG of Tripura Frontier. During the flag-off programme IG BSF Tripura, along with senior Officers of BSF and other Civil dignitaries will encourage the Cyclist.The Cycle Rally will be proceeding to different locations of Tripura.

The cycle rally will be covering approx 421 Km in Tripura subsequently, the rally will be crossing over to M&C Frontier on November 7th next.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Bru resettlement expedite, process to be completed by Feb 28
tripura.description: The rehabilitation process of all Bru migrants are going on speedily and till date altogether 4,102 Bru families were resettled in 12 designated spots across four districts of the state.
tripura.content:
The rehabilitation process of all Bru migrants are going on speedily and till date altogether 4,102 Bru families were resettled in 12 designated spots across four districts of the state.

Addressing a press conference here at Civil Secretariat on Saturday to highlight the achievements of the Revenue department, Principal Secretary Puneet Agarwal said that the entire resettlement process of 6,959 Bru families will be completed by February 28, 2023 next.

Urging the all Bru families with population of 37,136, Agarwal said that if all Bru families are not cooperate with government agencies for their fastest resettlement process in all 12 designated spots across 4 districts of the state by the extended dateline, then validation of tripartite agreement will not come into effect after February 28 next.

Government stressed on early completion of the rehabilitation process to all Bru migrants, Agarwal said that Bru leaders must be very cooperative to send the names of the rest families as per rehabilitation spots to the government before February 28 next.

As per the agreement among Tripura, Mizoram, Central governments and Bru organizations, a historic decision has been taken to rehabilitate all Bru families in 12 designated spots across the state and the entire rehabilitation process should be completed at the earliest.

He appealed to the leaders of Bru organization to cooperate with government agencies to make the process faster.

Agarwal said that the state government has selected 12 locations, where 6,959 families of Bru migrants with a population of 37,136 will be resettled in the specified locations in different districts of the state.

It may be recalled here that over two decades after they escaped ethnic violence in Mamit, Kolasib and Lunglei districts of Mizoram, 32,000 Bru migrants are now being permanently resettled in Tripura after an agreement signed by the Union government, state governments of Tripura and Mizoram, and the Bru migrants, in January 16, 2020 last.

Agarwal said that so far the leaders of Bru migrants have provided the spot wise resettlement list for 4,102 families and the resettlement process for the rest of Bru families is now going on rapidly in 12 designated spots of the state..

He said that so far the cleaning works of jungle in resettle areas, making the earth into plain land, construction of roads, infrastructures for drinking water and setting up of electricity connections, solar lighting systems, construction of toilets, schools, health sub-centre houses and common toilets are going on rapidly. Agarwal also appealed to all rest Bru families to come forward for their early resettlement.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: YC gheraoed CM residence protesting gang rape incidents
tripura.description: Protesting the series of gang rape incidents and alleged deteriorated law and order situation of the state, the Pradesh Youth Congress on Saturday staged a demonstration and gheraoed the private residence of Chief Minister.
tripura.content:
Protesting the series of gang rape incidents and alleged deteriorated law and order situation of the state, the Pradesh Youth Congress on Saturday staged a demonstration and gheraoed the private residence of Chief Minister.

Youth Congress activists led by its president Rakhu Das laid a siege in front of the private residences of the Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha at Banamalipur area and gheraoed the residences.

YC raised slogans against the Chief Minister and the state government, demanding immediate arrest of minister’s son in connection with the gang-rape incident of Kumarghat on October 19 and his dismissal from the council of ministers.

They tried to break the barricades and after a brief scuffle with a large number of police , all the agitators were arrested and police took them to the AD Nagar police line where they remained confined till evening.

Meanwhile the All India Democratic Women Association (AIDWA) or ‘Gana Tantrik Nari Samity’, a front organization of the CPI (M) also demanded resignation of the state women commission chairperson Barnali Goswami for her total failure to come to the rescue of women subjected to various forms of torture and repression. The AIDWA president and former MP (RS) Jharna Das Baidya said that the state women commission had totally failed to work for women and the entire body should resign.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Protests over gang rape incidents rock city
tripura.description: Protesting two gang rape incidents and alleged involvement of ruling party leaders, opposition parties on Friday hit the streets of Agartala and organized rallies after rallies.
tripura.content:
Protesting two gang rape incidents and alleged involvement of ruling party leaders, opposition parties on Friday hit the streets of Agartala and organized rallies after rallies.

On Friday afternoon addressing a press conference at Congress Bhavan senior Congress leader and MLA Sudip Roy Barman strongly castigated the state government over alleged lawlessness and claimed that anarchy prevails across the state.

Condemning the rule of state government and its police administration for proving safeguards to some ruling party leaders and a son of a minister, who were allegedly involved in two spate gang rape incidents held at Kumarghat and Kalyanpur, Sudip said that there are no rules of law and police are acting as political agent of ruling BJP.

While, in continuation of protest demonstration over two gang rape incidents, the activists of Tripura Pradesh Mahila Congress staged a demonstration in front of the office complex of Tripura Commission for Women (TCW) and engaged scuffle with on duty women police personnel. They finally entered the office complex and staged a demonstration.

Trinamool Congress (TMC) also organized a protest rally in the city led by party’s Rajya Sabha MP Sushmita Dev and state in-charge Rajib Banerjee demanding immediate police action.

Addressing another press meet in the city, Tripura state committee of All India Kisan Sabha (AIKS) has also condemned the rule of government over two gang rape incidents. AIKS leader Pabitra Kar speaking with the media said that the law and order situation of the state has totally collapsed and panic prevails across the state over miscreants’ activities.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: 38 NDPS act cases, 54 smugglers arrested in a month, police
tripura.description: In continuation of its drive against drug menaces and its trafficking, the state police in significant development have arrested 38 NDPS Act cases and arrested 54 persons within the span of last one month.
tripura.content:
In continuation of its drive against drug menaces and its trafficking, the state police in significant development have arrested 38 NDPS Act cases and arrested 54 persons within the span of last one month.

Addressing a press conference at police headquarters on Friday evening to highlight the achievements of state police, AIGP (Police Control) Jyotishman Das Chowdhury accompanied by AIGP(TSR) Subrata Chakraborty expressed their gratitude towards the people of Tripura for peaceful celebration of Durga Puja and Diwali festivals.

Das Chowdhury said that due to sincere efforts made by the state police, the property offenses have drastically come down and during the last three months, police have arrested over 95 property offenders and the drive against thieves and property offenders has also been continuing.

He said that during a special anti-narcotics drive, police have seized 2245 kilograms of dry cannabis, 256 grams of Heroin, 1911 bottles of contraband cough syrup and 2464 Yaba tablets. Police said that during the last conference on drug trafficking and National Security held at Guwahati, the Union Home Minister Amit Shah appreciated the efforts of state police for prevention of drug trafficking.

They said that a total of 380 awareness camps were organized under the banner of ‘Prayaas’ across the state to enhance community policing along with other civic action programmes.

Through , the special drive against helmetless driving, illegal parking, over speeding and violation of the traffic rules, over Rs. 60 lakh was realized as fine money under various sections of MV Act in the current month. Moreover, traffic enforcement has continued to prevent drunk driving, over speeding, fatal accidents and other traffic violations.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Investigation going on, law will take its own course, minister Bhagaban Das
tripura.description: Amidst statewide political tension and allegation with counter allegation issuing gang rape incident of Kumarghat and alleged involvement of a son of state’s minister, the minister Bhagaban Das himself said that investigation is going and everything will be cleared.
tripura.content:
Amidst statewide political tension and allegation with counter allegation issuing gang rape incident of Kumarghat and alleged involvement of a son of state’s minister, the minister Bhagaban Das himself said that investigation is going and everything will be cleared.

During a press meet held at Civil Secretariat on Friday evening to highlight the achievements of Scheduled Caste (SC) Welfare department, the minister of the department Bhagaban Das replying media quaries over allegations made by opposition parties over alleged involvement of his son in the gang rape on a minor girl held on October 21st night, the Minister said that he was aware of the police campaign organizing by opposition parties.

"Our party has made a statement over the issue and state police have also released a press statement over the issue," said Das and added that investigation is going on and everything will be cleared.

Hinting the propaganda politics of opposition parties, Das narrates a proverb “Hati Chale Bazar, Kutta Bhoke Hazar '' (Elephant goes to the market; Thousands of dogs bark).

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: On 9th day of hunger strike by retrenched teachers, 14 hospitalized so far
tripura.description: On the 9th day of the  “fast unto death” programme by a section of retrenched 10,323 teachers, the health conditions of many teachers deteriorated and they were shifted to IGM Hospital.
tripura.content:
On the 9th day of the “fast unto death” programme by a section of retrenched 10,323 teachers, the health conditions of many teachers deteriorated and they were shifted to IGM Hospital.

They started sit-in-demonstration from October 20 demanding their reinstatement in service and till Thursday, altogether 14 teachers were hospitalized.

Altogether 10,323 of teachers, who lost jobs after the High Court of Tripura terminated their appointments as illegal in 2014 and termination of their ad-hoc jobs after Supreme Court verdict , the retrenched teachers are continuing their agitation hunger strike, protest rallies and march to secretariat and Raj Bhavan for past few years, but till date they were to rehabilitate or reinstatement in service.

Speaking with media persons on the 9th day of their ‘fast unto death’ programme, some agitated retrenched teachers claimed that Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha, during a meeting with a delegation representing the retrenched teachers, had given assurance that a detailed discussion over the possibility of job restoration would be held after Lakshmi puja in the presence of heads of departments including Law secretary and Advocate General of the state, but till date no such measures have been taken for their rehabilitation.

They also alleged that before beginning the hunger strike programme, the retrenched teachers had duly informed all the departments of the state to cooperate with them by providing some logistic support like toilet and drinking water facilities in their agitation venue at Orient Choumohani in Agartala. But, no such help had been given to them and even on the 8th day of hunger strike, they were also not providing ambulances to shift their ailing teachers into hospital.

Speaking with media, retrenched teacher leader Arabinda Sharma said that with due regards they are still very much hopeful that Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha will call them and do something for their reinstatement of jobs. He said that their families are running a severe financial crisis after losing their jobs years ago and they are continuing their fast unto death programme only with moral support of hundreds of teachers, who have lost their jobs.

Sharma said that they want the government to convene the meeting at the earliest, as promised by the Chief Minister and should give a green signal to withdraw their ‘fast unto death’ programme and reiterated that they will continue their agitation till a final solution is assured by the government.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Departments should ensure benefits of “Prati Ghore Susashan” campaign, Nath
tripura.description: The all departments and agencies of the government should have ensure the benefits of “Prati Ghore Susashan” (good governance at every household)   to every families of the state to ensure benefits  of various state and central schemes for the people, said Education Minister Ratan Lal Nath.
tripura.content:
The all departments and agencies of the government should have ensure the benefits of "Prati Ghore Susashan"(good governance at every household) to every families of the state to ensure benefits of various state and central schemes for the people, said Education Minister Ratan Lal Nath.

Chaired a review meeting at the conference hall of West Tripura district on Thursday in presence of the authorities of all civic and rural bodies along with government officials, Nath seeking cooperation of state’s people said that the two-and-a-half-month long campaign has been initiated to ensure the benefits of all state and central government schemes for the people. He said that all the elected representatives and government officials should have to ensure that the benefits should reach all houses of the state’s people.

Nath, stressing on organizing camps in every local body for the “Prati Ghore Susashan” campaign, said that no people should be left out by getting the benefits of government’s schemes.

During the review meeting, Agartala Municipal Corporation (AMC) Mayor Dipak Majumder said that in order to reach the benefits of "Prati Ghore Susashan", the AMC on October 17, 18 and 19 last organized camps in all 51 wards of the corporation, where a total of 2,686 persons were given benefits of government schemes.

After a presentation of data in the review meeting, the District Magistrate (DM) of West Tripura Debapriya Bardhan said that as per the information available from 9 blocks of the district, altogether 14, 328 persons from Gram Panchayats, Nagar Panchayats and ADC Village Committees get the benefits of government schemes. Through the different schemes of the different departments, a total of 18, 755 families of West Tripura district so far get the benefits.

In the review meeting, the representatives of different line departments have also highlighted their department wise success and number of benefits given by them to the district’s people.

It may be recalled here that Tripura government has launched state level special campaign "Prati Ghore Susashan"(good governance at every household) to ensure benefits of various state and central schemes for the people of the state during the celebration of 72th birthday of Prime Minister Narendra Modi on September 17 last and as “Sewa Divas” encouraging people to take a pledge to offer their services towards fighting social evils, promoting Swachh Bharat Abhijan, holding blood donation camps etc. The 'Proti Ghore Shushashon' campaign has been launched to take the benefits of the flagship schemes of the Centre and the state government to the doorsteps of the people, from the district to the gram panchayat level and the campaign will continue up to November 30 next.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: SFI, AIDWA to continue protests demanding arrest of gang rape accused
tripura.description: Activists of SFI on Thursday staged a demonstration in front police headquarters in Agartala protesting gang rape incidents on minor girls and over deteriorating law and order situation across the state.
tripura.content:
Activists of SFI on Thursday staged a demonstration in front police headquarters in Agartala protesting gang rape incidents on minor girls and over deteriorating law and order situation across the state.

The students and their leaders under the banner of SFI and TSU gathered in front of police headquarters and gheraoed the police headquarters by organizing demonstrations in front of the entry gate of police headquarters.

During the protest demonstration agitated SFI leaders speaking with media persons said that since formation of BJP-IPFT government the crime against women reached at its peak in the state and often incident like gang rapes are also reported from different parts of the state. They alleged police are not maintaining their constitutional duties and spared rape accused due to their political patronage with ruling party.

Demanding immediate arrest of all gang rape accused involved on Kumarghat and Kalyanpur incidents, who are associated with influential ruling party leaders, the SFI-TSU will continue their agitation.

But, after a few minutes of agitation, large numbers of police forces rushed to the spot and forcefully arrested all agitators and vacated the road.

In another protest demonstration held in front of Agartala city centre on Thursday afternoon, the activists of All India Democratic Women's Association (AIDWA) organized a protest meeting and slammed the government over the deteriorating law and order situation.

Both students and women organizations of opposition CPI(M) said that they will continue their agitations demanding arrest of all gang rape accused persons involved in Kumarghat and Kalyanpur incidents.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Total six persons arrested for Kumarghat gang rape case
tripura.description: Amidst political tension issuing aging rape of a16-years old minor girl in Fatikroy area of Unakoti district on last October 20, the police has so far arrested six accused persons including a woman.
tripura.content:
Amidst political tension issuing aging rape of a16-years old minor girl in Fatikroy area of Unakoti district on last October 20, the police has so far arrested six accused persons including a woman.

Police sources said that on Tuesday, they have arrested one Baptu Das and Rajesh Malakar, who was rented a room in a three storey building located at Kumarghat town, where gang rape was committed on October 20.

Police sources added that based on the complaint filed by the family members of the victim girl, police have arrested six persons. The Superintendent of Police (SP) of Unakoti district, Kanta Jahangir said that the medical examination of the girl has been completed and all legal steps have been taken including recording of the judicial statement of the victim girl. She said that investigation is going on over the gang rape case under section-376(3), 109 of IPC and section-4 of POCSO Act.

Police added that preliminary investigation reveals that the victim girl was allured by her friend (another girl) and was taken to a rented room and was given a drink. Then, miscreants in intoxicated condition gang raped the victim girl.

Police said that they used scientific aid to investigate and other forensic techniques for the investigation and also expressed their gratitude to members of the public who helped in solving the case.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Another minor tribal girl 'gang raped' in Kalyanpur, 1 arrested
tripura.description: Amidst statewide political tension and allegation with counter allegation issuing gang rape of a 16-years old girl in Kumarghat, another incident of gang rape held at Kalyanpur area under Khowai district on Wednesday.
tripura.content:
Amidst statewide political tension and allegation with counter allegation issuing gang rape of a 16-years old girl in Kumarghat, another incident of gang rape held at Kalyanpur area under Khowai district on Wednesday.

Police sources said that minor tribal girl, who was returning home after attending cultural programme with her friends from Kash Kalyanpur area of West Dharikapur , was allegedly obstructed by few youths and snatched her mobile phone, they kidnapped her and gang-raped her night long. She also said that miscreants had allowed her other friends to return back to their houses, but she was not allowed to go back to her house.

On Wednesday, she somehow returned to her home in serious condition and narrated the heinous act committed on her by four miscreants to her parents. She also mentioned the names of four miscreants , who are allegedly owing allegiance to the ruling party.

Kalyanpur police station registered the case under section 376,341,325,354,392, 34 of IPC and section -4 of POCSO Act and started investigation. Police within 24-hours of the incident arrested one prime accused Tapash Debnath . Officer-in-charge (OC) of Kalyanpur police station and SDPO(Teliamura) Prasun Tripura said that an FIR has been registered against four persons including Aditya Das, Tapash Debnath, Ratan Debnath and Bidhan Datta.

Police added that they launched massive manhunt to arrest three other miscreants and soon they will be able to detain remaining three rape accused.

The incident came days after another teenager was allegedly gang raped in Unakoti district, with the opposition claiming that a state minister's son was involved in the crime.

Police added that all necessary legal processes including the medical test of the girl have also been completed.

While, after the incident reported, activists of Tipra-Motha and Congress staged a protest demonstration in front of Kalyanpur police station and demanding immediate arrest of all miscreants in involved in the gang raped.
