They also alleged that the ruling party try to give safeguards to miscreants involved in the incidents and if police are not able to arrest them within next 24-hours, then they will organize a road blockade programme at Teliamura-Khowai road.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Fair at Tripura Sundari temple extended for one day with improved weather
tripura.description: The cyclonic storm “SITRANG” dampen the festival spirit on first day of Diwali festival and fair at Mata Tripura Sundari temple complex, , but with improved weather conditions, the second day of fair (Mela) since Tuesday morning witnessing massive crowd and cheerful celebration of festival
tripura.content:
Agartala , October 26, 2022: The cyclonic storm “SITRANG” dampen the festival spirit on first day of Diwali festival and fair at Mata Tripura Sundari temple complex, , but with improved weather conditions, the second day of fair (Mela) since Tuesday morning witnessing massive crowd and cheerful celebration of festival.

After the devastating storm, which has weaken in Bangladesh entered into Tripura, disturbed the normal life and the festivities, the fair committee of Tripura Sundari temple has decided to extend the fair for one more day and government will resume the special train services from Dharmanagar and Sabroom connecting the temple town Udaipur.

Addressing a press conference on Tuesday afternoon, Udaipur Mela committee chairman and local MLA Biplab Kumar Ghosh said that the closing ceremony of the fair will be held on Wednesday evening and cultural programmes organized by the state government’s departments will continue up to 9 PM.

He said that the fair committee has requested all shop owners and traders, who were given stalls in the fair complex, have been requested to withdraw their makeshift stalls on Thursday morning.

Ghosh said that all debris including mud were removed by the fair committee on Tuesday morning for smooth passage of all devotees and initiated some renovation works for illumination.

It may be recalled here that on Monday evening after incessant rains and heavy winds due to cyclonic storm “SITRANG”, hundreds of devotees gathered in a temple complex sheltered at Matabari block office. During Monday night's storm, all the illuminations decorated in different roads connecting the Matabari collapsed and many were also uprooted due to the storm.

Altogether 658 stalls and shops were set up in the fair complex, but many of them have already withdrawn their shops on Monday night and they have suffered huge losses due to the storm.

On Monday evening, Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha through a brief programme inaugurated the Diwali festival at Mata Bari and highlighted the temple developmental initiative through ‘Prasad’ scheme and added that entire construction in the temple complex will be completed by next year. Dr Saha said after completion of all ongoing construction works, Mata Bari temple will be a most attractive destination for devotees.

After inauguration, the Chief Minister along with his wife also offered prayer and participated in the ‘Mangal Arati’.

During the inauguration of the festival, Information and Cultural Affairs (ICA) Minister Sushanta Chwodhury, Tourism Minister Pranajit Singha Roy, Tribal Welfare Minister Rampada Jamatia, local Biplab Kumar Ghosh were also present.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Fair at Tripura Sundari temple extended for one day with improved weather
tripura.description: The cyclonic storm “SITRANG” dampen the festival spirit on first day of Diwali festival and fair at Mata Tripura Sundari temple complex, , but with improved weather conditions, the second day of fair (Mela) since Tuesday morning witnessing massive crowd and cheerful celebration of festival.
tripura.content:
Issuing alleged gang rape of a 16-years old minor girl inFatikroy area of Unakoti district on last Friday night, triggered massive political reaction .

Opposition parties including CPI (M) and Congress alleged involvement of a minister’s son, though the victim girl in her statement recorded before the court did not mention his name.

On Sunday opposition parties and ruling parties organized processions and counter procession and after massive reaction, the police changed the investigating officer and assigned the task of investigation to Dy.SP Bina Sinha.

SDPO (Kumarghat) Kamal Debbarma said police have arrested three persons till today. One of them is the driver of the car used to take the victim into the scene of the crime, the lady who brought the girl from her house and the third accused was an alleged rapist.

Opposition political parties including the main opposition CPI (M), Congress and Trinamool Congress (TMC) demanding the arrest of the son of the minister staged protest demonstration in Kumarghat while the ruling party has started a counter campaign alleging that the name of the son of the minister is being dragged into the controversy for political mileage . They said the son of the minister was out of Kumarghat for the last several days and how can he be involved in the incident.

While, Congress leader Ashish Kumar Saha addressing a press conference at Congress Bhavan in Agartala on Sunday afternoon demanded an impartial probe over the incident and immediate arrest of all accused persons.

Meanwhile, BJP’s Kumarghat Mandal committee organised a rally, which passes various thoroughfares of Kumarghat and gathered at Bhagat Singh Choumohani, where they warned the opposition political parties to stop their agenda based politics on personal attack on their leader.

Police sources added that based on the complaint filed by the family members of the victim girl, police have arrested three persons. The Superintendent of Police(SP) of Unakoti district, Kanta Jahangir said that the medical examination of the girl has been completed and police have now changed the case and added section 376 of the IPC

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Over success of mass rally, ‘frustrated’ ruling party resorted violent attacks on CPI (M) supporters, Jitendra Chowdhury
tripura.description: Referring comments made by state BJP’s vice president Dr Ashok Sinha over the remarks of opposition leader Manik Sarkar for a united struggle by all secular forces against BJP, CPI (M) state secretary Jitendra Chowdhury claimed that it’s not an appeal for pre-poll alliance.
tripura.content:
Referring comments made by state BJP’s vice president Dr Ashok Sinha over the remarks of opposition leader Manik Sarkar for a united struggle by all secular forces against BJP, CPI (M) state secretary Jitendra Chowdhury claimed that it’s not an appeal for pre-poll alliance.

Chowdhury tried to clear all misunderstanding over the call given by the former Chief Minister Manik Sarkar to all secular forces to unite and said that the 23rd party Congress has entrusted all state units to choose their pre-poll alliance if there is any need.

Addressing a press conference here at CPI (M) headquarters on Saturday evening, CPI (M) state secretary Jitendra Chowdhury highlighting the success of party’s mass rally at Vivekananda stadium and obstructions, attacks on their supporters by ruling party workers in different parts of the state, Chowdhury said that based on the resolution taken in last 23rd party Congress, CPI(M) always in favour of united face of all secular forces. He said that the party Congress has allowed all the state units to choose the political alliance for elections if necessary and any unit can go for alliance or fight against their opponent without any alliance.

He said that party’s polit bureau member and opposition leader Manik Sarkar in the mass rally has also urged the secular forces to come together against oppression and divisive politics of BJP, but it’s not an appeal for pre-poll alliance.

He said that CPI(M) along with other left parties are capable of ousting the BJP from Tripura and if any pre-poll alliance is needed , then the party will take its decision in appropriate time.

While highlighting the success and obstacles on Friday’s mass rally, Jitendra Chowdhury said that the ‘necked’ face of ruling BJP was exposed on Friday and they had taken all steps to thwart their rally and many CPI (M) supporters had suffered injuries during attacks by the ruling party.

Despite many attempts, thousands of CPI (M) from different parts of the state had participated in the rally along with common people to strengthen the movement against the 55 months misrule of the BJP-IPFT government.

He alleged that ruling party and their affiliated union BMS workers have stopped hundreds vehicles boarded with party supporters , who were on way to Agartala to join the rally, even government machineries have also reduced the coaches of Dharmanagar-Agartala and Sabroom-Agartala local trains.

Giving details of the attacks on their rally-bound supporters in many parts, Chowdhury said that when people after attending the rally were returning their houses were also attacked and many supporters were also hospitalized.

The party has deported 30 buses at Agartala railway station and BMS workers were not allowed to run 25 buses and they also hijacked two buses from station, said Chowdhury and added that in absence of any transportation from Agartala station towards Agartala city, thousands of party supporters reached the rally venue on foots by covering distance of about 9 kilometers.

He said that ruling BJP over frustration seeing support of common people had launched statewide attacks since Friday night. "A total lawlessness prevails across the state and violent politics of BJP have also continued for the past 55 months," said Chowdhury and added that peace loving people will strengthen their movements against the BJP government in coming days to restore democracy in Tripura.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: BSF trained ‘Aapda Mitra’ for disaster management
tripura.description: The closing ceremony of training programme of community volunteers on Disaster Response in 109th battalion of BSF headquarters in Bagafa area of South Tripura district was held on Saturday.
tripura.content:
The closing ceremony of training programme of community volunteers on Disaster Response in 109th battalion of BSF headquarters in Bagafa area of South Tripura district was held on Saturday.

The ceremony was graced by Saju Vaheed A, DM of South Tripura, Ashok Kumar Yadav, Commandant, 109th battalion BSF and Sarad Kumar Das, State Project Manager of Disaster Management.

BSF sources said that trainees were trained with lectures on topics such as disaster management in general and acts, earthquake, Tsunami, lighting and thundering, Rescue and relief measures, snake and animal bites, role of media in disaster management etc. Practical topics such as patient assessment controlled bleeding and soft tissue injuries, BLS and CPR, oxygen therapy, medical emergencies, lifting and moving patients with improvised stretchers etc.

Commencement of training programme was on October 10 and continued up to October 22 at the battalion headquarters, which was sponsored by National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) and supported by Revenue department of Tripura government organized by District Disaster Management Authority (DDMA) of South Tripura district. Faculties of 109th battalion of BSF personnel along with guest faculties from DDMA trained the participating youths.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Seven Bangla nationals arrested from city
tripura.description: The capital city police, based on the suspicious movements, arrested seven Bangladesh nationals from Kali Bari area of Indranagar under NCC police station.
tripura.content:
The capital city police, based on the suspicious movements, arrested seven Bangladesh nationals from Kali Bari area of Indranagar under NCC police station.

Giving details officer-in-charge (OC) of NCC police station Subir Malakar said that based on secret information over the movements of some Bangladeshi nationals in Kali Bari area of Indranagar, a police team raided that area and detained seven persons.

After primary interrogation it has been established all these seven youths are citizens of Bangladesh and in absence of any valid documents, police arrested them under Passport Act, said Malakar.

He added that on Saturday all seven youths were produced before a local court. He said that they are all from Rajshahi district of Bangladesh and identified as Sahidul Sheikh, Rabban Sheikh, Jahir Ali, Sajib Ali, Mesaban Ali and Maidul Islam.

He said that arrested Bangladesh nationals revealed that they had arrived in Agartala in search of work and as court sent them in judicial custody, police will interrogate them during their judicial custody over the reason for their visit to India without any valid documents.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Akasa Air start services to Agartala via Guwahati to Bengaluru services
tripura.description: Newly-launched Akasa Air commences its flight services from Agartala airport from Friday and as part of this expansion, the airline connects the two Northeastern destinations Agartala via Guwahati to Bengaluru.
tripura.content:
Newly-launched Akasa Air commences its flight services from Agartala airport from Friday and as part of this expansion, the airline connects the two Northeastern destinations Agartala via Guwahati to Bengaluru.

Tripura Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha inaugurated the flight services from Agartala airport in presence of Transport Minister Pranajit Singha Roy and other top officials of Airport Authority of India (AAI) and Akasa.

These new flights will provide seamless one-stop connectivity between Bengaluru and Agartala with no change of aircraft required at Guwahati, said Akasa airline. The airline launched its services on the domestic routes from August 7 this year.

Akasa said it has been progressively expanding its operations and will be flying a total of 11 non-stop routes along eight cities - Ahmedabad, Bengaluru, Kochi, Chennai, Mumbai, Delhi, Guwahati, and Agartala from October 21. To further enhance connectivity on existing sectors, the airline has also announced additional daily flights on the Bengaluru-Chennai route also commencing from October 21.

Guwahati, the gateway to Assam, and Agartala are among the fastest growing cities in the region and the enhanced air connectivity will provide a boost to the immense potential of the region's aviation, industrial, and tourism prospects, said Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha inaugurating the services.

The 189-seater aircraft of “Akasa Air” will depart daily from Bangalore to Agartala via Guwahati and will fly directly to Bangalore from Agartala.

He said that with flight services from Tripura and with joining of AKasa, the students, their parents and other passengers along with the businessman community of the state will get the benefit of direct flight service up to Bengaluru.

Addressing the inaugural ceremony, Chief Minister Dr Saha was accompanied by the Transport minister Pranajit Singha Roy, Airport’s Director KC Meena and CMO of “Akasa Air” Belson Coutinho, Chief Minister congratulated the Akasa air for this initiative said that the present Maharaja Bir Bikram Airport was earlier known as Shingerbill Airport. That time, there were not so many security arrangements at the airport, but currently there are major changes in the state’s air connectivity and it has been possible because of the efforts of Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

Since the formation of Nrendra Modi led central government in 2014, the overall connectivity including road, rail and airways, the entire Northeast region including Tripura are getting the benefits of expanded and modern connectivity. Resulting in, the people of Tripura are now directly reaching major cities of the country through expansion of air services.

Dr Saha also requested the Akasa Air authorities to maintain their airfare within the reach of the state's people.

Transport Minister Pranajit Singha Roy highlighting the improvement of air connectivity in the state said the MBB airport in Agartala now operates 20 daily flights and tourists from other parts are getting the benefit of frequent flight services connecting Agartala. Keeping in view of growing demand of passengers, Singha Roy also requested the authorities of Akasa to start one more flight on Agartala-Delhi route.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Police Commemoration Day: Govt will always stand by the families of brave martyrs, CM
tripura.description: Police Commemoration Day is observed on Friday  with due dignity in the state along with the entire country. The main event was organized at Manoranjan Debbarma Memorial Stadium, Police Lines Arundhati Nagar, Agartala.
tripura.content:
Police Commemoration Day is observed on Friday with due dignity in the state along with the entire country. The main event was organized at Manoranjan Debbarma Memorial Stadium, Police Lines Arundhati Nagar, Agartala.

On the occasion, Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha paid tribute to the memory of all police and security forces who were martyred in the line of duty by placing a wreath at the memorial. After that Chief Secretary J.K Sinha, Director General of Police Amitabh Ranjan and other senior police officers paid tributes to the martyr. Police Commemoration Day programme paid tribute to 264 police and security forces jawans who lost their lives in the line of duty from September 1, 2021 to August 31, 2022.

Speaking to reporters at the programme organized by the Police Department, Chief Minister Dr. Manik Saha said that the government will always stand by the families of the brave jawans who sacrificed their lives to protect the country’s sovereignty. Police are an essential part of our society. They are engaged day and night to protect people’s life and property. He said that on this day in 1959, many Indian soldiers were martyred in an ambush by the Chinese army on Indian soldiers patrolling in Ladakh. Police Commemoration Day is observed to commemorate that day. Chief Minister said that 264 police and security forces jawans have been martyred while on duty in the country in the last one year. Among them, In-charge Inspector Satyajit Mallik was martyred while performing his duties at Khowai.

Chief Minister paid tribute to the memory of martyred In-charge Inspector Satyajit Mallik and gave condolences to his family. He said that the contribution of martyr Satyajit Mallik can never be forgotten.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: NFR to run two Diwali special train
tripura.description: The Northeast Frontier Railway has decided to operate two special trains between Agartala - Dharmanagar - Agartala and Agartala - Sabroom - Agartala to clear the extra rush of passengers during Diwali and mela at Tripureswari Temple, Udaipur. Both the trains will be operated from 23rd October to 26th October, 2022 on both directions.
tripura.content:
The Northeast Frontier Railway has decided to operate two special trains between Agartala - Dharmanagar - Agartala and Agartala - Sabroom - Agartala to clear the extra rush of passengers during Diwali and mela at Tripureswari Temple, Udaipur. Both the trains will be operated from 23rd October to 26th October, 2022 on both directions.

Special Train No. 07687 (Agartala - Dharmanagar), will depart from Agartala at 05:20 hours to reach Dharmanagar at 08:45 hours. Special Train No. 07688 (Dharmanagar - Agartala), will depart from Dharmanagar railway station at 10:35 hours to reach Agartala at 14:00 hours.

Special Train No. 07685 (Agartala - Sabroom), will depart from Agartala at 14:15 hours to reach Sabroom at 16:35 hours. Special Train No. 07686 (Sabroom - Agartala), will depart from Sabroom at 17:00 hours to reach Agartala at 19:35 hours.

Both the special trains will consist of 07 coaches. There will be six general sitting and one luggage cum guard van.

Further, train no. 52539/52538 (New Jalpaiguri – Darjeeling – New Jalpaiguri) AC passenger will remain cancelled from 22nd to 27th October, 2022 due to poor patronization.

The details of stoppages and timings of these trains are notified in various newspapers and social media platforms of N.F. Railway. Passengers are requested to see these details before undertaking their journey.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Nirman Shramik Welfare scheme 2.0 launched,Govt accords due respect, importance to construction workers: CM
tripura.description: The workers are the main architect of the nation and the present government accords due respect and importance to them, said Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha after launching the Nirman Shramik Welfare Scheme 2.0 at Rabindra Satabarshiki Bhavan on Thursday.
tripura.content:
The workers are the main architect of the nation and the present government accords due respect and importance to them, said Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha after launching the Nirman Shramik Welfare Scheme 2.0 at Rabindra Satabarshiki Bhavan on Thursday.

He also unveiled the cover of a booklet on this occasion. The chief minister said, the state government is sincere about the workers’ welfare and various schemes are being implemented towards their development. He said, like other states, Tripura also has a good number of skilled workforce. This government knows how to evaluate their skill. Earlier in the state a reign of owner-worker conflict was set in, but now that culture has been done away with. Both the owner and worker are dependent on each other. Earlier meetings, rallies etc. were common in the name of the workers movement, which is no longer existent in the rule of this government. Now the workers are getting their due wages in their accounts through DBT.

The Chief Minister also said, under the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi the central government is formulating new plans one after another. And the state government is also marching ahead on the footprints of the central government. He said, everybody should contribute to the development of the state. He also referred to the ongoing "Prati Ghare Sushason" campaign as a drive to reach out to the people in remote areas with various welfare schemes.

Speaking on the occasion the Labour Minister Bhagaban Chandra Das said, launching of the Nirman Shramik Welfare Scheme 2.0 marks a historic day in the state. He said, the present government after taking over has taken up various welfare schemes for the welfare of the workers. Because, this government believes not in slogans but in action. Transparency has been affected in the implementation of welfare schemes. The government is sincere about providing more benefits to the workers in the coming days.

At the launching programme the chief minister handed over cheques to the beneficiaries under Nirman Shramik Welfare Scheme 2.0. Additionally a labour cess collection portal has been launched by the chief minister today. Chairman of Tripura Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board and MLA Binoy Bhushan Das also spoke on the occasion. Welcome address was delivered by the secretary of labour department Abhishek Singh while vote of thanks was given by labour commissioner Dr. Naresh Babu N.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Retrenched 10,323 teachers start fast-unto-death
tripura.description: A large group of retrenched 10,323 teachers on Thursday started an indefinite “fast-unto-death” sit-in demonstration at Sakuntala road of Agartala city demanding reinstatement in service.
tripura.content:
A large group of retrenched 10,323 teachers on Thursday started an indefinite "fast-unto-death" sit-in demonstration at Sakuntala road of Agartala city demanding reinstatement in service.

Among the factions of retrenched teachers, the Victimized 10, 323 teacher organization after waiting for past four and half years for reinstatement of their services, they finally on Thursday launched the hunger strike for indefinite period and among the agitated hundreds of retrenched teachers, around 50 teachers are taking part in the fast-unto-death programme.

Recently, the Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha had invited the representatives of retrenched teachers for discussion over their condition and demand and getting the details of their termination process, verdict of apex court and reply from Supreme Court under the Right to information, Dr Saha had assured the delegation of teachers that he would call for the next round of discussion after ‘Durga Puja’.

But, the teacher organization on Thursday launched their hunger strike and speaking with media persons, retrenched teacher leader Pradip Banik said that they have waited long enough for the government to take positive action to protect their jobs and families but nothing has so far been done.

He said that teachers do not have any and no other alternative but to launch the peaceful agitation which will continue till their demands are met and has also appealed to the Chief Minister to give a green signal for their reinstatement else they will continue their hunger strike till their death.

Meanwhile, the ‘Tipra-Motha’ supremo and royal scion Pradyot Kishore Debbarma on Thursday met country’s renowned and leading lawyer Kapil Sibbal in New Delhi along with representatives of retrenched teachers to discuss the issue of their dismissal from service and to find out the legal process for their reinstatement. Pradyot in a tweet message said that Sibal will represent them and he is confident of getting the teachers some justice.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: BJP, TIPRA Motha show strength in hills, sporadic violence, few injured
tripura.description: Amidst statewide prevailing tension over political demonstrations among ruling BJP and Tipra-Motha in rural and hilly areas of the state, sporadic violence reported from few parts of the state and after pitch-battle among the supporters of both parties, about one dozen supporters’ sustained injuries and a TSR jawans also suffered injuries.
tripura.content:
Amidst statewide prevailing tension over political demonstrations among ruling BJP and Tipra-Motha in rural and hilly areas of the state, sporadic violence reported from few parts of the state and after pitch-battle among the supporters of both parties, about one dozen supporters’ sustained injuries and a TSR jawans also suffered injuries.

Police sources said that on Wednesday, Tipra-Motha organized protest demonstrations and submitted their memorandum before all BDOs of 58 blocks towards the Governor demanding early Village Committee (VC) elections in ADC areas and supporters of BJP had also organize rallies and submitted memorandum before the authorities of ADC zonal and sub-zonal offices demanding execution of developmental works in hilly areas.

But, during the rallies by both parties, clashes were reported in Baijalbari and Taidu areas of Khowai district and Ompi Nagar, resulting in about dozen of supporters of both parties suffering injuries.

Police sources added that they have deployed a large number of security forces in all areas where political parties organized their rallies and barring some stray incidents in three separate places, the political programmes by both BJP and Tipra-Motha completed peacefully.

Sources said during the deputations in the Baijalbari area of Khowai, the rallies of both parties faced each other in a spot and they started pelting stones targeting each other. During pitch-battle altogether 10 supporters and TSR jawans suffered injuries. Immediately, large numbers of security forces cordoned the entire area and dispersed all supporters.

Similar clash has also been erupted at Taidu and Ampinagar areas, but timely action by police forces the situation controlled within hours.

Sources added that when some unruly supporters of Tipra-Motha during their demonstration started pelting stones towards the supporters of BJP and they also ransacked the Ampinagar Mandal office and Gamako branch office of BJP. Within minutes the situation turned volatile and both party supporters started pelting stones targeting each other. As a result, four supporters of BJP and one supporter of Motha suffered injuries.

On Wednesday evening BJP Janajati Morch’s general secretary David Debbarma filed an FIR against a few supporters of Motha at West Agartala police station along with three of their injured supporters. Speaking with media persons, Debbarma alleged that when their supporters peacefully submitted their deputation before the Sub-zonal office at Simna, a group of Motha supporters attacked them and injured their four supporters. He said that after primary treatment at GB Hospital, they rushed to West Agartala police station and registered their complaint against miscreants of Motha.

Meanwhile, Tipra-Motha chairman Pradyot Kishore Debbarma in a social media post said that “if ma death can bring a solution then let it be so! This culture has ruined us and this is the reason why we have become slaves in the last 75 years. One day when I am no longer around you will realize the sacrifices of ours.” He also condemned the violence held during the protest and burning of his effigy by BJP supporters.

However, police said that after the attack and counter attack, the situation in three separate places including Taidu, Padmabil and Ampinagar are under control and large numbers of security forces were deployed in these areas.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: 156 schools to identify for introduction of PM SHRI Schools, Ratan Lal Nath
tripura.description: Altogether 156 schools in all 58 blocks and 20 urban bodies of the state will be identified for up gradation under PM SHRI Schools (PM Schools for Rising India) schemes.
tripura.content:
Altogether 156 schools in all 58 blocks and 20 urban bodies of the state will be identified for up gradation under PM SHRI Schools (PM Schools for Rising India) schemes.

Addressing a press conference here at Civil Secretariat on Wednesday evening, Education Minister Ratan Lal Nath said that more than 14,500 schools will be developed across India under the PM SHRI scheme with all the components of NEP 2020.

He said that NEP 2020 encourages a holistic, flexible and multidisciplinary approach to education as envisioned by the Prime Minister. "It is based on foundational pillars of access, equality, quality, affordability and accountability. It is aligned with Sustainable Development Goals 2030 goals."

Nath added that online, open and multi-modal learning has been promoted under the PM- eVidya.

The PM SHRI scheme has been implemented by the central government for the development of more than 14,500 schools across the country. The total project cost in PM SHRI scheme is Rs. 27,360 crore which includes a central share of Rs. 18,128 crores for the period of five years from the year 2022-23 to 2026-27.

The PM SHRI scheme will provide several benefits which include quality and innovation, Science and Math kits will be provided to these schools, annual school grants, early childhood care and education including balvatika and foundational literacy and numeracy equity and inclusion including the provision of safe and appropriate infrastructure for girls and CWSN, among other benefits. The PM SHRI scheme will also focus on strengthening existing infrastructures in schools and implementing green school initiatives.

Nath said that soon the identification for 156 schools will be completed and added that Vidyajyoti scheme is state sponsored scheme and it will be separated from PM SHRI Schools.

While giving details over the release of job offers for TET qualified candidates, Nath said that on Wednesday the Education department has released offer letters for 179 Post-Graduate Teachers (PGT) including 43 for economics, 46 for sociology, 49 for geography and 41 for physiology. He said that a total of 256 offers were released for TET-I and among them 196 persons submitted their offers till last date and the department has released 258 offers for TET-II and among them 247 persons submitted their offers.

Nath added that the Education department had already published advertisements through TRBT to fill up 3,108 vacant posts including 757 vacant posts for TET-I and 2,351 posts for TET-II. Apart from these, TRBT has also issued advertisements to fill up 60 more posts.

The Education Minister said that the Chama language will be introduced in 36 schools of the state including in secondary, higher secondary and in primary schools.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Only education can guide the society towards right direction: CM
tripura.description: Education is the backbone of society and only education can guide the society towards the right direction, said Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha after inaugurating Sri Aurobindo General Degree College at the old DIET building, Kunjaban in Agartala on Tuesday.
tripura.content:
Education is the backbone of society and only education can guide the society towards the right direction, said Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha after inaugurating Sri Aurobindo General Degree College at the old DIET building, Kunjaban in Agartala on Tuesday.

He said the college is the first government English medium College of the state. This is a mentionable step towards higher education in the state, said Dr Saha and added that English language is important for attaining higher education and a new chapter has been started in higher education in the state through inauguration of the English medium college.

The Chief Minister said, opening a new college is not an easy task. It was possible to open the college with the tireless efforts of the Education Minister and the department despite all challenges. The government will make more efforts in future towards infrastructural and academic development of the college.

Addressing the students, the Chief Minister said, only academic knowledge is not enough but practical education is also necessary. One has to build himself up as a human in society. One has to be good not only in academic learning but also in extra-curricular activities. One has to involve himself in social activities. The juniors must learn to respect their seniors. Only then, a student can build himself up as a true human being. Addressing the teachers, the Chief Minister said, the teachers must also keep themselves ready with new knowledge and information. This will only enhance teaching. The Chief Minister advised the parents to be mindful of their children to keep them away from the reach of drugs. He said, the state government is also continuing its efforts against addiction. The Chief Minister had paid tribute to Hrishi Aurobindo.

Education Minister Ratan Lal Nath in the programme said, only through education, one can achieve success in life. The present state government is playing its role responsibly towards development of human resources. It is possible to build human resources through proper education and improved healthcare services. The government is giving equal importance to these two factors. The Education Minister said, there are 128 pre-primary schools in the state at present. 21 colleges out of 25 colleges in the state have been recognized under NAAC. Lakhsya scheme has been started for national level skill development for students of the state. he said, Master Degree Courses in Bengali and English languages have been started in six General Degree Colleges.

Principal of Sri Aurobindo General Degree College Dipankar Chakraborty delivered a welcome speech. Mayor of Agartala Municipal Corporation (AMC) Dipak Majumdar and Director of Higher Education department N. C. Sharma also spoke on the occasion.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Students have to play a vital role to restore democracy in Tripura, Manik Sarkar
tripura.description: Time has always changed character and the present situation of the state is also changing rapidly and all people including students have to play vital roles for coming movements to restore the democracy in the state, said opposition leader Manik Sarkar.
tripura.content:
Time has always changed character and the present situation of the state is also changing rapidly and all people including students have to play vital roles for coming movements to restore the democracy in the state, said opposition leader Manik Sarkar.

Addressing the 20th state conference of Students’ Federation of India (SFI), held at Agartala Town Hall on Tuesday, Sarkar appeals to students to increase their public contact and conquer divisive politics of the ruling party.

"Students of the state have to play a strong and concrete role in the coming greatest movements to restore the proper atmosphere for education and they have to connect with more and more students for the coming movements, ", said Sarkar.

While castigating the rule of both central and state governments for introduction of new education policy, Sarkar said that the new policy does not have any presence and secular and democratic spirit of the country.

Highlighting the rule of the previous Left Front government for expansion of education across the state, Sarkar previous governments had budget allocation of about 21 to 23 % for education and the present government by decreasing it handing over the education system to private parties.

Sarkar, mentioning the four and half years old rule of BJP government in Tripura alleged that they have snatched the democratic rights of common people and has also snatched rights of education for poor people by introducing the privatization in education system.

The situation rapidly changed and within four and half years of time, altogether 6 MLAs belonging to ruling parties had resigned and highlighted the betrayal politics of the BJP government, said Sarkar and urged the people to take the advantage of changing situation and should create massive resistance against the violent politics of the ruling part.

‘Just 10 months before the next assembly elections, the central leadership of BJP had changed the chief minister of state, but they did not change their policies of deprivation,’, said Sarkar and added that by changing chief minister ruling BJP cannot overruled the 55 months long politics violence and misgovernance.

"A total anarchy and total lawlessness prevails across the state and all people united should resist them to restore the rules of law and democracy in the state," said Sarkar and appealed to all student leaders to visit educational campuses and connect with more students.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Six IAS officers transferred including two DMs
tripura.description: In a minor administrative reshuffle, few district magistrates (DMs) of the state were transferred including reshuffle of six senior IAS officers.
tripura.content:
In a minor administrative reshuffle, few district magistrates (DMs) of the state were transferred including reshuffle of six senior IAS officers.

As per the notification issued by the General Administration (Personnel and Training) department of the state said that senior IAS officer L H Darlong has been posted as Principal Secretary for Chief Minister and after his leave period , he will join the post.

Incumbent District Magistrate (DM) of Dhalai district L T Darlong has been transferred and posted as secretary of the state government and on assumption, Darlong will hold the charge of Tribal Welfare department and with additional charges of Director of Tribal Welfare department.

The director of Social Welfare and Social Education, Dr Siddhartha Shiv Jaiswal has been transferred as new District Magistrate (DM) of Dhalai district.

The DM of Unakoti district Uttam Kumar Chakma has been transferred and posted as secretary of the state government and Dr Vishal Kumar, the present director of Tribal Welfare department has been transferred as new DM for Unakoti district.

The notification added that on expiry of child care leave, IAS officer Smt. Smitha Mol is posted as new director of the Social Welfare and Social Education department and she will also hold the additional charges of CEO, TRLM and Mission Director of NULM, Agartala.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Police arrested a drug peddler, recovered tablets, cough syrups
tripura.description: Based on the interrogation statements of an arrested drug peddler, the capital city police on Tuesday burst a major drug supply  network and arrested another paddler with large quantities of contraband items.
tripura.content:
Based on the interrogation statements of an arrested drug peddler, the capital city police on Tuesday burst a major drug supply network and arrested another paddler with large quantities of contraband items.

Giving details, SDPO(Sadar) Ajoy Kumar Das said that based on the confessional statement of arrested drug paddler Soumyabrata Banik, who was arrested on Monday from Math Choumohani area under East Agartala police station with Brown Sugar, police on Tuesday arrested another drug paddler identified as Sujit Bhowmik of Jagaharimura area, who was with his Scotty moves every corner of the city and delivered banned and contraband tablets and cough syrups to their customers.

Police based on the information have laid traps in different parts of the city and managed to arrest him from Jail road and in the course of search operation, police recovered large quantities of SP tablets and Eskuf cough syrup under his possession, said Das and added that police also seized his scotty. Arrested paddler Sujit Bhowmik will produce before a local court on Wednesday with police remand appeal to unearth the entire nexus of drug smugglers and their chain of network.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Voting for AICC president post held at Congress Bhavan
tripura.description: The voting for the election to the post of All India Congress Committee (AICC) president was completed on Monday morning after 22 years here at Congress Bhavan along with other parts of the country.
tripura.content:
The voting for the election to the post of All India Congress Committee (AICC) president was completed on Monday morning after 22 years here at Congress Bhavan along with other parts of the country.

A total of 64 voters from Tripura Pradesh Congress Committee (TPCC) are eligible and casted their votes to elect Congress president candidates Shashi Tharoor and Mallikarjun Kharge.

PCC president Birajit Sinha said among the voters 63 voters casted their votes in TPCC office in Agartala and another voter and veteran party leader Gopal Roy cast his vote in Arunachal Pradesh. He said that the voting process started from 10 AM and continued up to 4 PM and voters cast their votes through a secret ballot. During the poll process Tripura Pradesh Congress’s working president Sushanta Chakraborty and Pancham Misra acted as election agents for both candidates.

AICC leader Abdul Hannan, the presiding officer for elections in Tripura said that the state’s ballot box has been sent to Delhi and counting will take place on October 19 and results will be declared the same day.

Hannan said AICC has set up 67 polling booths across the country 'Kharge vs Tharoor' fight, where the last electoral contest for the top post of the party took place in the year 2000 when Jitendra Prasada had suffered a crushing defeat at the hands of Sonia Gandhi.

For the Congress president election, Shashi Tharoor and Mallikarjun Kharge are the party's two contestants and the counting of ballots will be taken up on October 19 and results will be declared as to who between the two candidates, octogenarian Mallikarjun Kharge or shashi Tharoor, will win the election.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: In a devastating fire 5 shop, 2 houses completely gutted
tripura.description: In a devastating fire incident held at Hathkatha Bazar under Khowai district on Monday morning, five shops and two houses completely gutted into ashes, which had broke out from a computer shop.
tripura.content:
In a devastating fire incident held at Hathkatha Bazar under Khowai district on Monday morning, five shops and two houses completely gutted into ashes, which had broke out from a computer shop.

After the fire incident, immediately, firefighters rushed to the spot and in association with local people, they somehow managed to douse the engulf.

Firefighter sources said that fire erupted in the five shops from an electric short-circuit and engulf started from a computer shop near Bir Chandra HS School in Hathkatha Bazar and within minutes, the fire spread into four more shops.

At the back side of these shops house of one Ajoy Deb and house of another person were also completely gutted into ashes. Seeing the high flames of fire, another firefighting engine has also rushed to the spot and they managed to douse the fire.

Sources added that the properties amounting in lakhs have also been destroyed in the fire incident.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: City police arrested a drug peddler, recovered drugs
tripura.description: As part of the anti-narcotic drives by the Agartala city police on Monday evening one drug peddler was arrested from Math Choumohani area under East Agartala police station with large quantities of Brown Sugar and illegal liquors under his possession.
tripura.content:
As part of the anti-narcotic drives by the Agartala city police on Monday evening one drug peddler was arrested from Math Choumohani area under East Agartala police station with large quantities of Brown Sugar and illegal liquors under his possession.

Giving details of the raid, SDPO (Sadar) Ajoy Kumar Das on Monday evening said that based on specific information over procurement and sale of narcotic items, a team of police raided at the house of Sishir Kumar Banik at Math Choumohani area and in the course of search operation, police recovered large quantities of Brown Sugar vials and illegal liquors. Police arrested his son Soumyabrata Banik for running narcotic trade under NDPS Act case and he will be produced before a local court on Tuesday for further interrogation.

Das also said that police started an investigation to crack the nexus of drug peddlers across the city and area and after interrogation of the arrested peddler, they will be able to find out the routes of drug smuggling.

Based on other specific information, the police personnel from Battala and Ramnagar town outposts (TOPs) conducted joint raids and nabbed two drug peddlers namely Kudduch Miah of Bhati Abhoynagar and Mama Miah of bordering Rajnagar. Police also recovered and seized two pouches of Brown Sugar approximate weight of 16 grams under their possession. Both drug peddlers were arrested under Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act, 1985 (NDPS Act) case and will forward them before a local court on Tuesday with police remand appeals for further interrogation.

SDPO Das said that they will unearth the entire nexus of drug smugglers and will arrest more such peddlers operating in the city areas.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Former UP Minister Mahendra Singh nominated as poll observer for state BJP
tripura.description: The central leadership of BJP on Sunday appointed Mahendra Singh, a former minister in Uttar Pradesh, as the election in-charge for Tripura, where the Assembly polls will be held in 2023.
tripura.content:
The central leadership of BJP on Sunday appointed Mahendra Singh, a former minister in Uttar Pradesh, as the election in-charge for Tripura, where the Assembly polls will be held in 2023.

Rajya Sabha member Samir Oran and national president of BJP ST Morcha will be the co-in-charge. Singh, known as a strong and dedicated organizational leader of the BJP, who has served the party as national secretary and was also in charge of the party's affairs in Assam.

Singh is an MLC from Uttar Pradesh. He was a minister in the first Yogi Adityanath government in the state, but was not retained after the BJP was re-elected to power this year.

Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha in his tweet message said "heartiest congratulations to Hon’ble MLC Shri Mahendra Singh Ji and Shri Samri Oran Ji for being nominated as BJP’s observer and co-observer for upcoming assembly polls in Tripura. I believe the BJP will secure a historic win in the Assembly polls."

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Two Digital Banking Units in Agartala and Udaipur starts functioning
tripura.description: The Prime Minister Narendra Modi dedicated 75 Digital Banking Units (DBU) across 75 districts to the nation via video conferencing and 75 DBUs, two are in Agartala and Udaipur were also inaugurated by dignitaries.
tripura.content:
The Prime Minister Narendra Modi dedicated 75 Digital Banking Units (DBU) across 75 districts to the nation via video conferencing and 75 DBUs, two are in Agartala and Udaipur were also inaugurated by dignitaries.

The Agartala branch of Union Bank of India (UBI) and Udaipur’s Gokulpur branch of Punjab National Bank (PNB) have equipped DBU facilities in Tripura.

While, kicked off the DBU services in UBI branch at Agartala on Sunday, Information and Cultural Affairs (ICA) Minister Sushanta Chowdhury accompanied by chairman of Dainik Sambad Trust and veteran advocate Sanjoy Paul said the 75 Digital Banking Units (DBU) will further financial inclusion and enhance banking experience for citizens. “DBU is a big step in the direction of Ease of Living for the common citizens”, he said and added that such a banking setup, the government aims to provide maximum services with minimum infrastructure, and all of this will happen digitally without involving any paperwork.

It will also simplify the banking procedure while also providing a robust and secure banking system." “People living in small towns and villages will find benefits like transferring money to availing loans. Digital Banking Units are another big step in that direction which is going on in the country to make the life of common man of India easier", said Chowdhury.

He said that the government's aim of banking services to the last man in line will further expedite the DBU facilities.

Inaugurating the DBU services in Gokulpur’s PNB branch, Agriculture and Tourism Minister Pranajit Singha Roy hoped that the local people including businessman, farmers and other citizens of the locality will get the facilities of DBU.

Singha Roy said that the aim of the government is to empower the common citizen and make them powerful, and as a result, policies were made keeping in mind the last person and the entire government moving in the direction of their welfare and will make the banking system more transparent and user friendly to common people.

It may be recalled here that as part of the Union budget speech for 2022-23, the Union Finance Minister announced setting up the 75 DBUs in 75 districts to commemorate the country's 75 years of independence. The DBUs are being set up with the objective to ensure the benefits of digital banking reach every nook and corner of the country and will cover all the states and Union territories. 11 Public Sector Banks, 12 Private Sector Banks and one Small Finance Bank participated in the Sunday’s endeavour.},

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: Three youths died in past 24-hours, two suspected murders
tripura.description: In three separate incidents, three persons were died in three separate parts of the state and the family members of two persons alleged they were killed, while another body was found in hanging condition.
tripura.content:
In three separate incidents, three persons were died in three separate parts of the state and the family members of two persons alleged they were killed, while another body was found in hanging condition.

Police sources said that on Saturday midnight, one Samir Bhowmik (34) suffered critical head injuries near Kumarghat petrol pump under Unakoti district and was shifted to a local hospital. After his condition deteriorated, injured Samir was shifted to GB Hospital. But, on Sunday noon succumbed to death due to his critical head injuries.

While, victim family persons alleged that during the incident, Samir had Rs. 1 lakh with him, which has been missing after the accident and they also complain that considering the nature of injuries, it’s not a simple road accident and some foul play behind the death of Samir.

In another incident one 26-year-old young boy named Tapas Roy was severely beaten to death by some local youths owing allegiance to the ruling party in Chelagang Subhash Colony area under Amarpur police station on Friday evening. Later, the family members of the injured boy rescued him and took him to a local hospital. But his condition was critical and he was shifted to GB Hospital for better treatment where succumbed to death on Sunday.

It is alleged that the youths demanded a large amount of Durga Puja subscription, but Tapas Roy's family refused to pay the huge amount of subscription as per their demand. Later on Friday, some youths of the area got together and entered his house and they vandalized the house, then they beat Tapash Roy and his mother. On Sunday morning during treatment Tapas Roy died in the GB Hospital.

Later, his family filed a specific FIR against all miscreants responsible for the death of Tapas, who was an active worker of DYFI.

In the third incident, the local police of Bholagiri area under NCC police station Agartala noticed a body of a young man hanging in a tree and they informed the matter to police. Police rushed to the spot and recovered the body and identified the deceased youth as Ranjit Sarkar (35), by profession a driver.

After autopsy police handed over the body to his relatives and they speaking with media persons said that they are in to total dark over the reason of suicide of Ranjit Sarkar. While, police added that they registered an unnatural death (UD) case and started investigation to unearth the reason for his suicide.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: More leaders to join Tipra-Motha to strengthen Tipraland demand, Pradyot
tripura.description: Before the ensuing 2023 assembly elections in Tripura, the regional Tipra-Motha will not leave any stone unturned to win the elections to fulfill their main demand of ‘greater Tipraland’, said Tipra-Motha’s chairman Pradyot Kishore Debbarma.
tripura.content:
Before the ensuing 2023 assembly elections in Tripura, the regional Tipra-Motha will not leave any stone unturned to win the elections to fulfill their main demand of ‘greater Tipraland’, said Tipra-Motha’s chairman Pradyot Kishore Debbarma.

Addressing a press meet here at Manikya Court on Saturday afternoon, where after resigning from Tripura assembly, former IPFT MLA from Raima Valley constituency (Gandacherra) Dhananjay Tripura on Saturday formally joined Tipra-Motha along with hundreds of supporters and leaders from Raima Valley.

Pradyot said that one malicious propaganda has been campaigning against their party by spreading false narrative that Motha is a communal party, but in reality the Motha only wants development of Autonomous District (ADC) areas and its people irrespective of caste and creed.

"I am from the family, which has given patronage to Rabindranath Tagore and lakhs of refugees, ", said Pradyot and added that nowadays the politics of regional parties has been changed and more and more people are strengthening the movements of Tipra-Motha.

He said more leaders from different political parties will soon join Tipra-Motha and strengthen their movements for ‘greater Tipraland’.

He once again reiterated that if the government of India wants for dialogue , they are ready for that and the government has to assure them in writing for greater Tipraland. He said that they are not against any political party, but will not repeat the politics, which had been formed before last 2018 assembly elections.

He also appealed to the government that they are elected representatives and the government should invite them for dialogue, especially the Union Home Ministry to fulfill their demands.

Pradyot again reiterated that Motha will contest the 2023 assembly elections of its own and will not take a single penny from political parties like the BJP, CPI(M) or from Congress.

Speaking in the press meet former IPFT MLA Dhananjoy Tripura alleged that ruling BJP did nothing for the development of 12 lakh tribal populations of the state and strengthen the movements led by Pradyot Kishore, he has decided for resignation.

"We will work for 12 lakh Tiprasa under the leadership of Maharaja and will strengthen the ‘Dopha’ (society) to fulfill the dream of greater Tipraland, " said elated Dhananjoy.

He also said that there are no politics remaining in ruling alliance IPFT as the guardian of the party is now battling for his life due to illness.

Tripura said that with the so-called package for ADC, the development for indigenous people will not come into reality else they are now empowered with separate state status. Former IPFT MLA has also asked why not a smart city project for Khumulwng, if the present BJP government wants to develop the socio-economic status of the tribal.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: 13 TPS, IPS officers transferred
tripura.description: In another administrative reshuffle, altogether 13 police officers including one IPS and 12 TPS Grade-II officers in different wings of state police.
tripura.content:
One after one successive operation, the capital city police has managed to curb growing incidents of stolen cases across the city and within the last 18 days, altogether 15 noted thieves were arrested only by West Agartala police station.

Giving details of their successive operations to control activities of thieves and other miscreants around the city, SDPO (Sadar) Ajoy Kumar Das on Saturday said that on Friday midnight, the police personnel from West Agartala police station arrested two noted thieves identified as Sukhen Hrishi Das of Durga Choumohani area and Sukhen Tanti of Ranir Bazar area.

He said that based on secret information, police have arrested the duo from their hideouts and stolen items including LED TV under their possession. Das added that both arrested thieves were also involved in a number of stolen incidents committed across the city and both arrested thieves will be produced before a local court with police remand appeals for further interrogation.

He hoped that soon , the city police would manage to arrest the remaining gang members of thieves, who had created panic across the city by committing stolen incidents one after one.

tripura.author: Our Correspondent
tripura.title: 15 noted thieves arrested in last 18 days by city police
tripura.description: One after one successive operation, the capital city police has managed to curb growing incidents of stolen cases across the city and within the last 18 days, altogether 15 noted thieves were arrested only by West Agartala police station.
tripura.content:
In another administrative reshuffle, altogether 13 police officers including one IPS and 12 TPS Grade-II officers in different wings of state police.

The General Administration (Personnel and Training) department through a notification issued on Saturday said that six Dy.SPs of the state police were transferred as new subdivisional police officers (SDPOs) for Teliamura, Longtharai Valley, Sabroom, Kamalpur, Santirbazar and for Udaipur subdivisions.

Among the transferred police officer one IPS officer Mourya Krishna Chandrasekar posted as assistant SP of North Tripura district has been transferred as new SDPO of Santirbazar and other TPS grade-II officers were transferred as SDPOs, Dy.SPs in Crime Branch, Traffic unit, PHQ, GRP, CIAT and in Home Guard organizations.
